member.summary: Exception Klasse für Ausnahmen bei der Aktionsverarbeitung. Die Eigenschaft Message von System.Exception ist mit einem sinnvollen Text gesetzt.

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.Action
member.summary:
Base class for all "Actions". An Action is an object, that receives various MouseInput events once it has been "Set" by a call to . After performing the required tasks, the Action is removed from the ActionStack and the previous active action is resumed. The action on the bottom of the action stack is the . Use the for typical drawing purposes, because it provides a convenient set of methods. If an action object is set by a call to the following sequence of calls to the new and the old action is executed:
new action: (as a reaction to )
old action: (may call if desired)
new action: (from now on the new action may receive mouse events).
After the new action calls or someone calls the new action will receive .
The old action (if still on the stack) will receive a call to and finally
the new action will receive a call to as a last call.

member.name: P:CADability.Actions.Action.FeedBack
member.summary: Provides access to the "feedback" object, which is used to define visual feedback of the action. When objects in a model are modified, you will immediately see the feedback (if this model is visible in a ). But sometimes you need more feedback, like arrows or imtermediate objects that change while the mousinput (or controlcenter input or some other conditions) change. Add those objects to the feedback and they will be displayed immediately.

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.Constr3DBox
member.summary: Construction of a box. Normally startpoint (left downer corner) width, length and height define the box in x-y-z-orientation. Definition of x-, y- or z-direction by defining a vector refering to the startpoint change the axis-parallel orientation of that box-axis

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.Constr3DCone
member.summary: Construction of an cone. the base construction uses startpoint, endpoint and radii. Startpoint and endpoint define the cone middleaxis (direction in space and height). You can specify the height before as distance from startpoint. If you specify radius instead of endpoint, you get a cone standing upright on active drawing plane.

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.Constr3DCylinder
member.summary: Construction of an cylinder. the base construction uses startpoint, endpoint and radius. Startpoint and endpoint define the cylinder middleaxis (direction in space and height). You can specify the height before as distance from startpoint. If you specify radius instead of endpoint, you get a cylinder standing on active drawing plane.

member.name: M:CADability.Actions.Constr3DFaceExtrude.OnSetAction
member.summary: Overrides

member.name: M:CADability.Actions.Constr3DFaceExtrude.GetID
member.summary: Overrides

member.name: M:CADability.Actions.Constr3DFaceExtrude.OnDone
member.summary: Overrides

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.Constr3DScrewPath
member.summary: Action to screw a path along an axis. Path and axis must reside in a common plane. An open path will be screwed with a pitch connectiong the start- and endpoint (a line is added when needed) and a solid object is created with this path and a cylindrical kernel. A closed path can be screwed with aa arbitrary pitch.

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.Constr3DSphere
member.summary: Construction of an sphere. The construction uses centerpoint and radius.

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.Constr3DTorus
member.summary: Construction of an torus. The construction uses centerpoint and radii with torus in drawingplane. If optional endpoint is fixed, centerpoint and endpoint define the torus middleaxis (direction in space).

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults
member.summary: All default values of the construct actions are static members of this class. So they can be stored from one construction to the other.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultStartPoint
member.summary: The startpoint of a line. Normally it is set at the end of a line-constrution to the endpoint of that line, so a new line can start at the endpoint of the last line by using the TAB-button within the startpoint-textfield to accept the default point.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultLineLength
member.summary: The default length of a line. Normally it is set at the end of a line-constrution to the length of that line, so a new line can start with the length of the last line by using the TAB-button within the length-textfield to accept the default length.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultLineDirection
member.summary: The default direction of a line. Normally it is set at the end of a line-constrution to the direction of that line, so a new line can start with the direction of the last line by using the TAB-button within the direction-textfield to accept the default direction.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultLineAngle
member.summary: The default angle of a line. Normally it is set at the end of a line-constrution to the angle of that line, so a new line can start with the angle of the last line by using the TAB-button within the angle-textfield to accept the default angle.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultLineDist
member.summary: The default dist of a parallel-line. Normally it is set at the end of a line-constrution to the distance of that line to its parallel source, so a new line can start with the distance of the last line by using the TAB-button within the length-textfield to accept the default angle.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultArcCenter
member.summary: The default center of a circle or arc. Normally it is set at the end of an arc-constrution to the center of that arc/circle, so a new arc/circle can start with the center of the last arc/circle by using the TAB-button within the center-textfield to accept the default center.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultArcRadius
member.summary: The default radius of a circle or arc. Normally it is set at the end of an arc-constrution to the radius of that arc/circle, so a new arc/circle can start with the radius of the last arc/circle by using the TAB-button within the radius-textfield to accept the default radius.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultArcDiameter
member.summary: The default diameter of a circle or arc. Normally it is set at the end of an arc-constrution to the diameter of that arc/circle, so a new arc/circle can start with the radius of the last arc/circle by using the TAB-button within the diameter-textfield to accept the default diameter.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultArcDirection
member.summary: The default direction of an arc. Normally it is set at the end of an arc-constrution to the direction of that arc, so a new arc can start with the direction of the last arc by using the TAB-button within the direction-textfield to accept the default direction.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultEllipseCenter
member.summary: The default center of an ellipse or ellipsenarc. Normally it is set at the end of an ellipse-constrution to the center of that ellipse, so a new ellipse can start with the center of the last ellipse by using the TAB-button within the center-textfield to accept the default center.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultEllipseMajorRadius
member.summary: The default majorradius of an ellipse or ellipsearc. Normally it is set at the end of an ellipse-constrution to the majorradius of that ellipse(arc), so a new ellipse(arc) can start with the majorradius of the last ellipse(arc) by using the TAB-button within the majorradius-textfield to accept the default majorradius.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultEllipseMinorRadius
member.summary: The default minorradius of an ellipse or ellipsearc. Normally it is set at the end of an ellipse-constrution to the minorradius of that ellipse(arc), so a new ellipse(arc) can start with the minorradius of the last ellipse(arc) by using the TAB-button within the minorradius-textfield to accept the default minorradius.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultScaleDistort
member.summary: The default way of the scale-modification of activated objects. If DefaultDistort is true, there can be different factors in the main axis, which will distort the objects

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultCopyObjects
member.summary: The default way of the modification of activated objects. If DefaultCopyObjects is true, a copy of the activated objects is modified, if it is false, the original objects are modified.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultRoundRadius
member.summary: The default radius of the round-actions in the tools-menue. Normally it is set at the end of a round-action to current radius, so a round action can start with the radius of the last action by using the TAB-button within the roundradius-textfield to accept the default radius.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultRectWidth
member.summary: The default width of a rectangle/parallelogram. Normally it is set at the end of a rectangle-constrution to the width of that rectangle, so a new rectangle/parallelogram can start with the width of the last rectangle/parallelogram by using the TAB-button within the width-textfield to accept the default width.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultRectHeight
member.summary: The default height of a rectangle/parallelogram. Normally it is set at the end of a rectangle-constrution to the height of that rectangle, so a new rectangle/parallelogram can start with the height of the last rectangle/parallelogram by using the TAB-button within the height-textfield to accept the default height.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultBoxHeight
member.summary: The default height of a 3D-box. Normally it is set at the end of a box-constrution to the height of that box, so a new box can start with the height of the last box by using the TAB-button within the height-textfield to accept the default height.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultDirectionPoint
member.summary: The default method for the way to detect the direction from an object. 0=startpoint, 1=start/endpoint, 2=endpoint, 3=midpoint, 4=direction of mouseposition

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultDirectionOffset
member.summary: The default method for the way to detect the direction-offset from an object. 0=original, 1=right, 2=opposite, 3=left

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultCutOffLength
member.summary: The default length of the cut-off actions in the tools-menue. Normally it is set at the end of a cut off-action to current length, so a cut off action can start with the length of the last action by using the TAB-button within the cut off length-textfield to accept the default length.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultCutOffAngle
member.summary: The default angle of the cut-off actions in the tools-menue. Normally it is set at the end of a cut-off action to current angle, so a cut off action can start with the angle of the last action by using the TAB-button within the cut off angle-textfield to accept the default angle.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultCutOffMethod
member.summary: The default method of the cut-off actions in the tools-menue. Normally it is set at the end of a cut-off action to current method, so a cut off action can start with the method of the last action by using the TAB-button within the cut off angle-textfield to accept the default method.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultDimPoint
member.summary: The locationpoint of a dimension. Normally it is set at the end of a dimension-constrution to the current position of that dimension, so a new dimension can start at the location point of the last dimension (plus an offset) by using the TAB-button within the dimensionpoint-textfield to accept the default point.

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultDimensionMethod
member.summary: The default way of collecting and handling points for a dimension ("0" means only 2 Points, "1" means multiple point input, "2" means 2-point-dimension referred to the first point).

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultDimensionPointMethod
member.summary: The default way of collecting a point for a point or labeling dimension ("true" means snap points, "false" means perpendicular foot points of objects).

member.name: F:CADability.Actions.ConstrDefaults.DefaultTextSize

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.ConstrLineLengthAngle
member.summary: Construction of a line, specifying a poit, a length and a direction of the line. All construct actions are internal, but the base class "ConstructAction" is public.

member.summary: This is the line. It will be manipulated during the construction and finally added to the model

member.summary: Constructuor, no need to do anything

member.name: M:CADability.Actions.ConstrLineLengthAngle.OnSetAction
member.summary: Overrides OnSetAction of ConstructAction. Here we create the new line and define the input for the construction

member.summary: Overrices OnRemoveAction of ConstructAction, when the action is removed. There is actually no need to override it

member.name: M:CADability.Actions.ConstrLineLengthAngle.GetID
member.summary: Overrides GetID of Action. Each action mus have an ID. It is usually the MenuID that starts the action. It must be different from any other action ID.

member.name: M:CADability.Actions.ConstrLineLengthAngle.OnDone
member.summary: Overrides OnDone of ConstructAction. the defaulStartPoint is updated with the value of the endpoint of the line (so the next line will start here. There is no need to update the other default values, this is done automatically. Make sure to call the bas implementation, because there the line will be added to the model.

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.ConstructAction.DefaultLength
member.summary: A DefaultLength object is usually used in conjunction with a object (see ). It specifies a default value for the input field as long as the user didn't specify that input via keybord or mouse. When the length input is locked, the value is saved in the corresponding DefaultLength object. DefaultLength objects are usually static in a ConstructAction to preserve that value from one instance of the action to the next instance.

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.ConstructAction.GeoVectorInput
member.summary: Defines an input object for an action derived from ConstructAction. This input object extpects the input of a vector. The vector may be either entered on the keyboard or by moving the mouse. The calculation of a vector from the mouse position depends on various settings. Pressing enter or TAB or clicking the mouse proceeds to the next input object.

member.name: M:CADability.Actions.ConstructAction.GeoVectorInput.SetVectorFromPoint(CADability.GeoPoint)
member.summary: Sets the point as a basis for the calculation of the vector. The calculated vector is the vector from this point to the mouseposition.

member.name: P:CADability.Actions.ConstructAction.GeoVectorInput.DefaultGeoVector
member.summary: Sets a DefaultGeoVector, which should be a static value, that carries the last input value of this vector to the next instantiation of the action.

member.name: P:CADability.Actions.ConstructAction.GeoVectorInput.IsAngle
member.value: The vector should be interpreted as an angle (IsAngle==true) or as a direction (IsAngle==false). For an angle there is no vector length, i.e. the length will always be 1 (unit vector). The PropertyDisplay will only display a single value (the angle in the drawing plane), the subentries will contain two angles: drawingplane angle and elevation from drawing plane

member.name: P:CADability.Actions.ConstructAction.GeoVectorInput.PlaneForAngle
member.summary: Defines the plane in which the angle should be computed. The input point will be projected into this plane and the Angle to the x-axis will be used as the input

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.ConstructAction.PlaneInput
member.summary: Defines an input object for an action derived from ConstructAction. This input object expects the input of a plane. The value may be either entered on the keyboard or by moving the mouse. There is always a base plane which is by default the drawing plane. The mouse input is defines a plane which is parallel to the base plane and contains the mouse point (snapping is applied) Pressing enter or TAB or clicking the mouse proceeds to the next input object.

member.name: T:CADability.Actions.SelectObjectsAction
member.summary: The used to select GeoObjects of a (visible) . Mouseclicks in the view are used to determine which objects should be selected. The user can select a rectangular area by dragging the mouse while the left button is pushed. Dragging from left to right selects all objects completely inside the rectangle, dragging from right to left selects all objects which are touched by the ractangle. The determins on which level the selection is performed, the adds additional filtering the the selection process.

member.name: T:CADability.UserInterface.EditableProperty`1
member.summary: Defines a base clas for editable properties shown on a property page (IPropertyPage) in the controlcenter (properties explorer). It is a single entry in the property page which may have subentries. Usually a property of type of some object is connected with this EditableProperty, e.g. the startpoint of a line or the distance of hatch lines or some setting value. The communication with the object which hold the property is either done via delegates or via reflection. When the user clicks on the value part of the , an editbox is activated to edit the value of the property. There must be a and method defined in the derived class, which convert the property value in a string and vice versa. The value of the property may be changed by the editbox (typing) or from the outside.

member.name: M:CADability.UserInterface.EditableProperty`1.#ctor(CADability.UserInterface.EditableProperty{`0}.GetValueDelegate,CADability.UserInterface.EditableProperty{`0}.SetValueDelegate,System.String,System.String)

member.summary: Checks, whether a Focus change from oldFocus to newFocus implies a focus change from "toTest" or one of its child entries to some entry outside of "toTest". If oldFocus is not toTest or one of its children "false" is returned. If the focus changes from one child of toTest to another or from a child of toTest to toTest itself or from toTest to one of its children, false is returned.
member.param: the entry that lost the focus
the entry that got the focus
member.returns: true if toTest lost the focus

If the focus changes from one child of toTest to another or from a child of toTest to toTest itself or from toTest to one of its children, false is returned.

the entry that got the focus

member.name: T:CADability.UserInterface.StringTable
member.summary: StringTable is a class that returns language dependant strings from (hardcoded) string IDs. All language dependant user interface texts are processed here. CADability contains an xml file as a primary string resource, containing all user interface texts in german and enlish language. You can Add more strings and more languages by calling , or by simply providing an xml file named "CADability.StringTable.xxx.xml" (where xxx stands for any language or application specific abbreviation) in the directory where CADability.dll is located.

member.name: M:CADability.UserInterface.StringTable.GetFormattedString(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Returns a formatted string. The string with the ID "Name" from the string resource is formatted by substituting the {0}, {1} ... substring with the string values of the args objects. If there is a formatting error, the unformatted string will be returned.

Variable number of arguments for formatting
member.returns: The formatted string

member.summary: Returns an array of strings from the string table. The array is created from a single entry in the string table. The first character of this entry is the separator and the remaining string is splitted by this separator.
member.param: Name or ID of the string
member.returns: The exploded string

member.name: M:CADability.AnimatedView.StartAnimation(CADability.ISchedule,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Starts the realtime animation. provides a time factor, 1.0 is real time. The method returns immediately. There may bee zooming and scrolling during the animation. The animation may be stopped at any time and stops automatically when endTime is reached. Each discrete frame that is displayed fires the to enable the user of this class to provide some additional display changes or other tasks.

member.name: T:CADability.Curve2D.Curves2D
member.summary: This class provides some static Methods concerning the interaction of two ICurve2D objects.

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.Curves2D.TangentLines(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D)
member.summary: Calculates lines that are tangential to both the first and the second curve. Returns an array of 2D points, where each pair of points represent a line. The number of points is always even. Implemented for circles or arcs only.

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.Curves2D.TangentLines(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.GeoPoint2D,CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Calculates the start- and endpoints of lines that are tangential to the given curves. There may be any number of solutions, including no solution. Each solution consists of two points: 1.: the startpoint, 2.: the endpoint of the Line. the startpoint lies on the first curve, the endpoint on the second. The length of the returned array is a multiple of 2 (or 0). If both curves are circles or arcs, all possible solutions are returned. If a curve is mor complex than a circle (e.g. bspline, ellipse) only the solution closest to the points p1 and p2 is returned.

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.Curves2D.TangentCircle(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the center points and the tangential points of the circles that are tangential to the given curves and have the given radius. There may be any number of solutions, including no solution. Each solution consists of three points: 1.: the center, 2.: the tangential point to the first curve, 3.: the tangential point to the second curve. The length of the returned array is a multiple of 3 (or 0)
member.returns: the requested center points

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.Curves2D.TangentCircle(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.GeoPoint2D,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates the center points and the tangential point of the circles that are tangential to a given curve with a given circlepoint and have the given radius. There may be any number of solutions, including no solution. Each solution consists of two points: 1.: the center, 2.: the tangential point to the curve. The length of the returned array is a multiple of 2 (or 0)
member.returns: the requested center points

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.Curves2D.TangentCircle(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.GeoPoint2D,CADability.GeoPoint2D,CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Calculates the center points and the tangential points of the circles that are tangential to the given curves. If the curves are lines or circles all possible solutions are revealed. If the curves are more complex, only the solution that is closest to the given points is revealed. Each solution consists of 4 points: 1.: the center, 2.: the tangential point to c1, 3.: the tangential point to c2, 4.: the tangential point to c3. The radius mus be calculated by the distance of the center to one of the tangential points. The length of the returned array is a multiple of 4 (or 0)
member.returns: Quadruples of GeoPoint2D defining 0 or more circles

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.Curves2D.Connect(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D)
member.summary: Connect two curves: the endpoint of the first curve with the startpoint of the second curve.
member.returns: true if succeede, false otherwise

member.summary: Returns the minimum distance of the two given curves.
member.param: returns the point on the first curve
returns the point on the second curve
member.returns: The value of the minimum distance

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.Curves2D.SimpleMinimumDistance(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.GeoPoint2D,CADability.GeoPoint2D@,CADability.GeoPoint2D@)
member.summary: Returns the minimum distance of the two given curves. If the curves are parallel, the connection of p1 and p2 will go through preferredPosition.
member.param: returns the point on the first curve
returns the point on the second curve
member.returns: The value of the minimum distance

member.summary: Constructs two arcs that connect and and are tangential to and respectively.

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.Curves2D.DistanceAtDirection(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,CADability.GeoVector2D)
member.summary: Calculates the distance of the two curves in the provided direction. In other words this means how far con you move the curve in the direction so that it touches the curve? The result may be double.MaxValue if the curves will never touch eac other, or it might be negative if you would have to move first in the opposite direction of dir to touch second. Currently only implemented for and .
member.returns: Distance

member.summary: Get the normalised equation of a line between two points in the form: Ax + By + C = 0
member.returns: true on success

member.name: T:CADability.Curve2D.I2DIntersectable
member.summary: Zum verschneiden von unendlichen Linien, Parabeln, Hyperbeln(, Sinuskurven?), die nicht längenbeschränkt sind, und nicht unbedingt im Parameter von 0 bis 1 laufen

member.name: T:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D
member.summary: Interface for a 2-dimensional curve. 2-dimensional curves occur e.g. in the parametric system of surfaces to build the outline of faces or as projections of 3-dimensional curves on a plane. There is a normalized parametric system for the curve that starts at 0.0 and ends at 1.0

member.name: P:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.StartPoint
member.summary: Sets or gets the startpoint. The endpoint remains unchanged when setting the startpoint.

member.name: P:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.EndPoint
member.summary: Sets or gets the endpoint of the curve. When the endpoint is set, the startpoint remains unchanged.

member.name: P:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.StartDirection
member.summary: Returns the direction of the curve at the startpoint.

member.name: P:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.EndDirection
member.summary: Returns the direction of the curve at the endpoint.

member.name: P:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.MiddleDirection
member.summary: Returns the direction of the curve at its middle point.

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.DirectionAt(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the direction of the curve at the provided normalized position.
member.returns: The direction

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.PointAt(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the point of the curve at the provided normalized position
member.returns: The point

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.PositionOf(CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Returns the position of point p on the curve: 0.0 corresponds to the StartPoint 1.0 to the EndPoint

member.name: P:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.Length
member.summary: Returns the length of the curve

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.Distance(CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Returns the distance of the specified point to this curve. If this curve can be extended (e.g. a line or an arc) this method will return the distance to the extended curve. If you need the distance to the unextended curve use .
member.param: Point to compute the distance to
member.returns: the distance

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.MinDistance(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D)
member.summary: Returns the minimal distance between this curve and the other curve given in the parameter. If the two curves intersect, the minimal distance ist 0.
member.param: curve to compute the distance to

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.MinDistance(CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Returns the distance of the point to the curve. In opposite to this method will return the distance to the unextended curve
member.param: Point to compute the distance to
member.returns: the distance

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.PerpendicularFoot(CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Calculates the foot points of the perpendicular projection of the given point on the curve. Perpendicular foot points are points, where the direction of the curve ist perpendicular to the line that connects foot-point to the given point.
member.returns: array of foot points

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.TangentPoints(CADability.GeoPoint2D,CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Calculates the points where the direction of the curve is parallel to the direction from the given point to the calculated point. For circles and ellipses it reveals all possible solutions, for other curves (e.g. BSpline) it reveals only the closest solution to the point "CloseTo".
member.param: Find the solution close to this point
member.returns: array of tangential points

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.TangentPointsToAngle(CADability.Angle,CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Calculates the points where the direction of the curve is parallel to the direction of the given angle. For circles and ellipses it reveals all possible solutions, for other curves (e.g. BSpline) it reveals only the closest solution to the point "CloseTo".
member.param: Find the solution close to this point
member.returns: array of tangential points

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.TangentPointsToAngle(CADability.GeoVector2D)
member.summary: Calculates the points where the direction of the curve is parallel to the given direction. Returns all possible position within the curve (not the extended curve)
member.returns: positions found

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.GetInflectionPoints
member.summary: Returns a list of onflection points of this curve. Teh list might be empty
member.returns: List of inflection points

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.Reverse
member.summary: Reverses the direction of this curve

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.Copy(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D)
member.summary: Copies the data of the given object to this object. Both objects must be of the same type.
member.param: Copies the data of this object

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.Project(CADability.Plane,CADability.Plane)
member.summary: The 2d-curve is assumed to reside in plane "fromPlane". It will be projected perpendicular onto the plane "toPlane".
member.returns: the projected curve

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.IsParameterOnCurve(System.Double)
member.summary: Determines, whether the given parameter denotes a point inside the bounds of the curve. i.e. the parameter must be greater or equal to 0.0 and less than or equal 1.0. The actual interval is a little bit extended according to the value.
member.returns: true if on curve

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.IsValidParameter(System.Double)
member.summary: Determines, whether the given parameter is valid for this curve. Some curves are restricted to a parameterrange by their nature.
member.returns: true if valid

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.GetExtendedHitTest
member.summary: Returns an IQuadTreeInsertable interface. The HitTest Method of this interface returns true if the rectangle coincides with the infinite extension of this curve (unbounded curve). Most curves are not extendable and therefore simply return "this".

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.GetSelfIntersections
member.summary: Returns pairs of double values. Each pair defines the two parameters of the curve of a self intersection. The result is either empty or has an even number of double values.
member.returns: self intersection parameters

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.ReinterpretParameter(System.Double@)
member.summary: Some curves especially Arc and EllipseArc have two possibilities to define a parameter of a point outside the curve: either as a parameter less than 0 which means ahead of the startpoint or as a parameter greater than 1 behind the endpoint. This method brings the given parameter into the other system, that means a parameter less than 0 will become greater than 1 and vice versa. Parameters between 0 and 1 will remain unchanged as well as most curves will return false, because the double interpretation isnt meaningfull.
member.returns: true if possible, false otherwise

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.Approximate(System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Approximate this curve and return the approximation. maxError specifies the maximal allowed error, i.e. the maximal deviation of the returned curve from this curve. Is linesOnly ist true, only lines are returned, if linesOnly is false, lines and circular arcs are returned. The result is usually a path consiting of lines and arcs or lines only.

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.Move(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Move the curve by the given offset

member.name: P:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.IsClosed
member.summary: Determins wether this curve is a closed curve (e.g. a circle)

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.GetModified(CADability.ModOp2D)
member.summary: Returns a ICurve which is this curve modified by m. The curve can be of different type, e.g. a Circle may return an Ellpse

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.GetFused(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D,System.Double)
member.summary: Returnes a new curve of the same type which is the fusion of this curve with the provided curve, e.g. two overlapping lines build a longer line. Returnes null if the fusion is not possible (e.g. a line and an arc or two lines with different direction)

member.name: M:CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D.TryPointDeriv2At(System.Double,CADability.GeoPoint2D@,CADability.GeoVector2D@,CADability.GeoVector2D@)
member.summary: Tries to get the point and the first and second derivative of the curve at the specified position. (0..1) Some curves do not implement the second derivative and hence will return false.
member.param: Position where to calculate point and derivatives
The point at the required position
The first derivative at the provided parameter
The second derivative at the provided parameter

member.name: T:CADability.Curve2D.GeneralCurve2D
member.summary: This class serves as an implementation helper for the ICurve2D interface. It cannot be instantiated and there are no methods for public use.

member.name: T:CADability.Curve2D.InfinitePath2D
member.summary: Interne Klasse für den HitTest für verlängerte Pfade oder PolyLines. Wird lediglich für das Suchen im QuadTree verwendet, muss deshalb nicht so genau sein. Insbesondere werden von der ersten und letzten Kurve die Verlängerunden verwendet, was nicht exakt ist, denn man müsste nur die Verlängerung in eine Richtung verwenden. Sollte aber keine Probleme machen. Wird nur für offene PolyLinien bzw. Pfade verwendet.

member.summary: Precision: two curves are combined if the resulting curve differs less than this value from the orginal curves.

member.summary: Break up polylines added to this object. Depending on the result may again be combined to polylines or paths.

member.name: F:CADability.Curve2D.Reduce2D.UsedOriginals
member.summary: When adding GeoObjects with the method Add(GeoObjectList l, Plane pln), a list of used GeoObjects is maintained when the result "Reduced" is calculated. "UsedOriginals" provides a list of those objects, that are represented in the result. The objects might also be children of the provided objects.

member.name: T:CADability.Attribute.Filter
member.summary: This class filters s according to their attributes or other properties. A contains a which contains Filters. The task of a filter is to decide, whether a IGeoObject is accepted by this filter or not. The is used by the to decide, whether an object may be selected or not. Filters may also be used for other purposes. In this standard implementation the attributes of a IGeoObject and the type of the object are used to accept or reject an object. You may derive a class from this Filter class and handle the static delegate by constructing your own filter. In your derived class you can use any criteria of a IGeoObject for filtering, e.g. the contents of .

member.name: T:CADability.Attribute.FilterList
member.summary: A FilterList is a list of s. The owns a FilterList which is used by the to decide which s may be selected or must be rejected. You may add a handler to the event to do your own filtering or use the default filtering machanism (or both). The FilterList of the project is displayed in the ControlCenter and may be interactively manipulated.

member.summary: An implementation of a , that defines a style consisting of contours inside the shape.

member.name: T:CADability.Attribute.HatchStyleContour.EHoleMode
member.summary: How to proceed with holes in the area to be filled.

member.name: F:CADability.Attribute.HatchStyleContour.EHoleMode.circumscribe
member.summary: Create curves that go around the holes.

member.name: F:CADability.Attribute.HatchStyleContour.EHoleMode.skip
member.summary: Simply break the curves that fill the area

member.name: F:CADability.Attribute.HatchStyleContour.EHoleMode.both
member.summary: circumscribe the first curve and skip all following curves

member.name: T:CADability.Attribute.HatchStyleContour.ESpiralMode
member.summary: Parallel or continous filling modes

member.name: F:CADability.Attribute.HatchStyleContour.ESpiralMode.Parallel
member.summary: Creates parallel contours to the inside of the enclosing contours or the outside of the holes

member.name: F:CADability.Attribute.HatchStyleContour.ESpiralMode.ContourSpiral
member.summary: Connects the parallel contours to one ore more paths to build a continuous contour theat goes as a kind of spiral from the outside to the inside

member.name: F:CADability.Attribute.HatchStyleContour.ESpiralMode.RoundSpiral
member.summary: Ctreates a round spiral that couvers the whole form and is clipped by the definig CompoundShape

member.name: F:CADability.Attribute.HatchStyleContour.ESpiralMode.ContourSpiralClosed
member.summary: Same as ContourSpiral, but the outermost contour is always closed

member.name: T:CADability.LinearAlgebra.CholeskyDecomposition
member.summary: Cholesky Decomposition.
member.remarks: For a symmetric, positive definite matrix A, the Cholesky decomposition is an lower triangular matrix L so that A = L*L'. If the matrix is not symmetric or positive definite, the constructor returns a partial decomposition and sets an internal flag that may be queried by the property.

member.name: T:CADability.LinearAlgebra.EigenvalueDecomposition
member.summary: Eigenvalues and eigenvectors of a real matrix.
member.remarks: If A is symmetric, then A = V*D*V' where the eigenvalue matrix D is diagonal and the eigenvector matrix V is orthogonal. I.e. A = V.Multiply(D.Multiply(V.Transpose())) and V.Multiply(V.Transpose()) equals the identity matrix. If A is not symmetric, then the eigenvalue matrix D is block diagonal with the real eigenvalues in 1-by-1 blocks and any complex eigenvalues, lambda + i*mu, in 2-by-2 blocks, [lambda, mu; -mu, lambda]. The columns of V represent the eigenvectors in the sense that A*V = V*D, i.e. A.Multiply(V) equals V.Multiply(D). The matrix V may be badly conditioned, or even singular, so the validity of the equation A = V*D*Inverse(V) depends upon V.cond().

member.name: F:CADability.LinearAlgebra.EigenvalueDecomposition.n
member.summary: Row and column dimension (square matrix).

member.name: T:CADability.LinearAlgebra.LUDecomposition
member.summary: LU Decomposition.
member.remarks: For an m-by-n matrix A with m >= n, the LU decomposition is an m-by-n unit lower triangular matrix L, an n-by-n upper triangular matrix U, and a permutation vector piv of length m so that A(piv,:) = L*U. If m < n, then L is m-by-m and U is m-by-n. The LU decompostion with pivoting always exists, even if the matrix is singular, so the constructor will never fail. The primary use of the LU decomposition is in the solution of square systems of simultaneous linear equations. This will fail if IsNonSingular() returns false.

member.name: T:CADability.LinearAlgebra.QRDecomposition
member.summary: QR Decomposition.
member.remarks:
For an m-by-n matrix A with m >= n, the QR decomposition is an m-by-n orthogonal matrix Q and an n-by-n upper triangular matrix R so that A = Q*R.
The QR decompostion always exists, even if the matrix does not have full rank, so the constructor will never fail. The primary use of the QR decomposition is in the least squares solution of nonsquare systems of simultaneous linear equations. This will fail if IsFullRank() returns false.

member.summary: Array for internal storage of decomposition.

member.summary: Array for internal storage of diagonal of R.

member.summary: QR Decomposition, computed by Householder reflections.
member.remarks: Provides access to R, the Householder vectors and computes Q.

member.returns: true if R, and hence A, has full rank.

member.param: A Matrix with as many rows as A and any number of columns.
member.returns: X that minimizes the two norm of Q*R*X-B.

member.name: T:CADability.LinearAlgebra.SingularValueDecomposition
member.summary: Singular Value Decomposition.

remarks.p: For an m-by-n matrix A with m >= n, the singular value decomposition is an m-by-n orthogonal matrix U, an n-by-n diagonal matrix S, and an n-by-n orthogonal matrix V so that A = U*S*V'.
The singular values, sigma[k] = S[k, k], are ordered so that sigma[0] >= sigma[1] >= ... >= sigma[n-1].
The singular value decompostion always exists, so the constructor will never fail. The matrix condition number and the effective numerical rank can be computed from this decomposition.

member.remarks: (vermorel) The initial implementation was assuming that m >= n, but in fact, it is easy to handle the case m < n by transposing all the results.

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.BSpline
member.summary: A BSpline is a smooth curve defined by a set of control points. It is implemented as a NURBS - non uniform rational b-spline.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.BSpline.ThroughPoints(CADability.GeoPoint[],System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Makes this BSpline go through the given points. Previous data of this BSpline (if any) is discarded. The BSpline remembers both this points and the calculated poles, multiplicities, knots and weights values. If all points lie in a single plane it is better to use the appropriate ThroughPoints method.
member.param: List of points to pass through
maximum degree for the BSpline. Must be between 3 an 25
true if the resulting BSpline should be closed
member.returns: success

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.CurveException
member.summary: Exception thrown by object implementing .

member.summary: Enumeration of different causes for this exception

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.CurveException.Mode.Internal
member.summary: Internal error

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.CurveException.Mode.General
member.summary: General error

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.CurveException.Mode.NoPlane
member.summary: No plane defined

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.CurveException.ExeptionMode
member.summary: Cause of this exception

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.PlanarState
member.summary: Enumeration for the classification of the planar state of a curve

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.PlanarState.Planar
member.summary: The curve resides in a certain plane

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.PlanarState.UnderDetermined
member.summary: There are several planes for this curve, i.e. the curve is a line

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.PlanarState.NonPlanar
member.summary: The curve is not planar

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.PlanarState.Unknown
member.summary: The state is unknown or not yet calculated

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.IOrientation
member.summary: ---Yet to be used--- Imagine a coordinate system moving along a 3d curve. Th z-axis always showing in direction of the curve. The x- and y-axis are still arbitrary. This orientation interface defines the direction of the x-axis at some point

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve
member.summary: Interface implemented by one-dimensional geometric objects (eg. line, circle, bspline etc.). The curve may be open or closed.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.StartPoint
member.summary: The start-point of the curve. If the curve is closed, this is the point where the parameter is 0.0.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.EndPoint
member.summary: The endpoint of the curve. If the curve is closed, this is the point where the parameter is 1.0.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.StartDirection
member.summary: The direction of the curve at the start-point. If the curve is closed, this is the direction where the parameter is 0.0.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.EndDirection
member.summary: The direction of the curve at the endpoint. If the curve is closed, this is the direction where the parameter is 1.0.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.DirectionAt(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the direction of the curve at a specified point. The parameter prosition of the start-point is 0.0, the parameter position of the endpoint is 1.0. Directions of a position outside this interval may be undefined.
member.returns: The requested direction

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.PointAt(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the point of the given position. The parameter prosition of the start-point is 0.0, the parameter position of the endpoint is 1.0. Points of a position outside this interval may be undefined. The correlatioon between the parameter Position and the resulting point may be not linear.
member.returns: The requested point

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.PositionAtLength(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the parameter of the point at the given position. The position must be in the interval [0, Length]. The correlatioon between the parameter Position and the resulting position is linear. The result is usually used for or .
member.returns: The requested position

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.PositionOf(CADability.GeoPoint)
member.summary: Returns the parametric position of the point on the curve. This function is invers to . If the given point is not on the curve, the result is the position of a point on the curve, that is close to the given point, but not necessary of the closest point.
member.returns: the requested position

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.PositionOf(CADability.GeoPoint,System.Double)
member.summary: Similar to . If the point is not on the curve and there are several solutions then the solution closest to the parameter prefer will be returned.
member.param: preferable solution close to this value
member.returns: the requested position

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.PositionOf(CADability.GeoPoint,CADability.Plane)
member.summary: Similar to the method. Returns the same result, if the point is on the curve. If the point is not on the curve the problem is looked at in the given plane. i.e. the closest point on the projected 2d curve from the projected 2d point is used.
member.param: Plane for the computation of the closest point
member.returns: the requested position

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.Length
member.summary: Returns the length of the curve.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.Split(System.Double)
member.summary: Splits the curve at the given position. The position must be in the interval 0..1 and the curve must not be closed. For closed curves .
member.returns: the splitted curve(s)

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.Split(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Splits the closed curve into two open curves at the given positions.
member.returns: the splitted curve(s)

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.IsClosed
member.summary: Determines, whether the curve is closed or open.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.IsSingular
member.summary: Determines, whether this curve is singular, i.e. it is only a point, returns the same value for each parameter

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.Reverse
member.summary: Reverses the direction of the curve.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.Trim(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Modifies start and endpoint of this curve. StartPos must be less than EndPos. if StartPos is less than 0.0 or EndPos greater than 1.0 this only works for lines and (circular or elliptical) arcs.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.Clone
member.summary: Returns an identical copy of this curve

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.CloneModified(CADability.ModOp)
member.summary: Returns a modified copy of this curve
member.returns: modified copy

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.GetPlanarState
member.summary: Determins the state of the curve in space. A curve may be either Planar (e.g. a cicle), NonPlanar (e.g. a polyline with vertices that dont shear a common plane) or UnderDetermined (e.g. a line defines a sheaf of planes (Ebenenbüschel))

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.GetPlane
member.summary: Determins the plane in which the curve resides. Throws CurveException if the curve's PlanarState is NonPlanar or UnderDetermined.
member.returns: The plane

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.IsInPlane(CADability.Plane)
member.summary: Determines whether the curve resides in the given plane.
member.returns: true, when the curve resides in the plane

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.GetProjectedCurve(CADability.Plane)
member.summary: Orthogonally projects this curve into the given plane. Returns the 2D curve in the coordinate system of the given plane.
member.param: The plane this curve will be projected on
member.returns: The 2D curve in the given plane

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.Description
member.summary: Returns a description of the curve, used in labels of the controlcenter.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.IsComposed
member.summary: Returns true, if the curve is composed of other curves. s and s are composed curves.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.SubCurves
member.summary: Returns subcurves of composed curves. s and s are composed curves.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.Approximate(System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a or a that approximates the curve with lines or lines and arcs.
member.param: Maximum derivation from the exact curve
member.returns: The Approximation

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.TangentPosition(CADability.GeoVector)
member.summary: Returns a list of positions where the curve has the same or opposite direction as the given direction. Mainly used for visualisation purposes. If there are no such points (which is true in most cases) An empty array should be returned.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.GetSelfIntersections
member.summary: Returns the self intersection position of this curve. The returned array contains pairs of parameter values. Each intersectionpoint corresponds to two parameters.
member.returns: Parameters of the intersection points

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.SameGeometry(CADability.GeoObject.ICurve,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns true, if this curve and the provided curve describe the same curve in space (maybe opposite direction)
member.param: The curve to be compared with
member.returns: true, if geometrically equal

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.GetExtent
member.summary: Returns the bounging cube for this curve
member.returns: The cube bounding this curve

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.HitTest(CADability.BoundingCube)
member.summary: Determins whether this curve interferes with the provided cube.
member.returns: True, if curve and cube interfere

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.GetSavePositions
member.summary: Returns some positions (parameter values between 0.0 and 1.0) that can savely be used for Approximation purposes Usually not used by external applications

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.GetExtrema(CADability.GeoVector)
member.summary: Returns points of the curve (parameter values between 0.0 and 1.0) where the curve is tangential to a plane defined by the normal vector . These points are minima or maxima in that direction.
member.returns: Positions of the extrema, if any

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.GetPlaneIntersection(CADability.Plane)
member.summary: Returns the parameters of the intersection points with the provided plane
member.returns: Intersection parameters, may be empty

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.DistanceTo(CADability.GeoPoint)
member.summary: Returns the minimal distance of point p to the curve.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.TryPointDeriv2At(System.Double,CADability.GeoPoint@,CADability.GeoVector@,CADability.GeoVector@)
member.summary: Tries to get the point and the first and second derivative of the curve at the specified position. (0..1) Some curves do not implement the second derivative and hence will return false.
member.param: Position where to calculate point and derivatives
The point at the required position
The first derivative at the provided parameter
The second derivative at the provided parameter

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ICurve.ParameterToPosition(System.Double)
member.summary: convert the parameter, which is in a natural system (0..2*pi for circle, first knot to last knot for bspline) to the 0..1 normalized position

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Ellipse.IsCircle
member.summary: Returns true if both axis of the ellipse have the same length. It may be a circle or a circular arc.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Ellipse.IsArc
member.summary: Returns true if it is not a full circle or a full ellipse, i.e. the is not -2*pi and not 2*pi.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Ellipse.StartParameter
member.summary: Gets or sets the startparameter of this circular or elliptical arc. The startparameter determins the startpoint of this curve according to the formula: Center + cos(StartParameter)*MajorAxis + sin(StartParameter)*MinorAxis For elliptical arcs the startparameter is not identical to the angle of the startpoint.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Ellipse.SweepParameter
member.summary: Gets or sets the sweep amount of this arc. A full circle or ellipse must have a sweepparameter of either 2.0*Math.PI or -2.0*Math.PI, The sweep parameter of circular or elliptical arcs are in the range of -2.0*Math.PI < SweepParameter < 2.0*Math.PI. SweepParameter is often used in connection with startParameter

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Ellipse.ParameterOf(CADability.GeoPoint)
member.summary: Returns the Parameter of the given point projected into the plane of this ellipse (pp). For a circle or arc this is the radian of the angle of the point. For an ellipse this is the value (a), where e.x = center.x+majorradius*cos(a), e.y = center.y+minorradius*cos(a) yields a point (e) on the ellipse so that (pp) coincides with the line (center,e).
member.returns: The parameter value

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.Face
member.summary: A face is a finite piece of a surface. It is bounded by a in the 2-dimensional u/v space of the surface. A face is also a . The bounding curves of a face are implemented as s. If a face is contained in a it doesnt share its edges with other faces. If a face is part of a (which maybe a part of a ) it shares some or all of its edges with other faces.

member.summary: Checks whether the provided 2d point in the parameter space of the surface is inside the bounds of this face. If the surface is periodic then it will also be checked whether the point with its periodic offset is contained in the face. In this case, the 2d coordinates of the point are updated to reflect the correct period in which it is inside the face

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Face.Distance(CADability.GeoPoint)
member.summary: Returns the smallest distance from the provided point to the face. It will be the distance to a perpendicular footpoint on the face. If there is no such perpendicular footpoint double.MaxValue will be returned. This method does not compute the distance to edges or vertices. If you need those distances use and .
member.param: Point from which the distance is calculated
member.returns: The signed distance, positive is to the outside, negative to the inside

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Face.ReplaceEdge(CADability.Edge,CADability.GeoObject.Face)
member.summary: die gegebene edge soll in dieses Face eingebaut werden. Eine Umrisskante wird zunächst auf dem ganzen Face erzeugt und dann in die beiden betroffenen split Faces eingebaut

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Face.OrientedOutward
member.summary: Returns the orientation of this face. this is only meaningful if this face is part of a closed shell which defines a solid. If true, the normal vector of the surface of this face points outward of the solid, if false it points into the inside.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Face.GetTriangulation(System.Double,CADability.GeoPoint[]@,CADability.GeoPoint2D[]@,System.Int32[]@,CADability.BoundingCube@)
member.summary: Returns the triangulation of this face to the provided precision. and are two arrays of the same length specifying the vertices of the triangle in 3d or 2d surface coordinates. is a list of indizes to trianglePoint and triangleUVPoint where each triple of indices describes one triangle. The length of triangleIndex is a multiple of 3.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Face.MakeRegularSurface(System.Double)
member.summary:
PRELIMINARY! Tries to use a more simple surface for this face. E.g. a NurbsSurface will be reduced to a torodial surface if the data allows it. The followind replacements are currently performed
NurbsSurface -> PlanarSurface
NurbsSurface -> TorodialSurface
in work:
NurbsSurface -> CylindricalSurface
NurbsSurface -> SphericalSurface
NurbsSurface -> ConicalSurface
SurfaceOfRevolution -> CylindricalSurface
SurfaceOfRevolution -> TorodialSurface
SurfaceOfRevolution -> ConicalSurface
SurfaceOfLinearExtrusion -> PlanarSurface
SurfaceOfLinearExtrusion -> CylindricalSurface
member.param: The maximum aberration of the surfaces
member.returns: true if surface could be simplyfied

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Face.ReverseOrientation
member.summary: Reverses the orientation of this Face. the normal vector on any point of the surface will point to the opposite direction

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Face.Split(System.Collections.Generic.List{CADability.Edge},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.List{CADability.Edge}})
member.summary: Mache ein neues Face, welches diesem entspricht und durch die neue outline bzw. holes gegeben ist Die Kanten wandern von diesem Face zum neuen, d.h. das primaryFace bzw. secondaryFace der Kanten wird geändert. Somit wird dieses Face ungültig.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.IGeoObject.UpdateAttributes(CADability.Attribute.IAttributeListContainer)
member.summary: When an IGeoObject changes the context that contains the lists of attributes it must replace its attributes by those given in the new context. If there are no appropriate attributes in the new context, these attributes must be included int this new context. This happens when drag and drop operations are executed or when a model is copied from one project to another project. contains a complete implementation regarding the attributes , , , , , and
member.param: The context, usually a Project which contains the attribute lists

member.summary:
Sets an attribut to the GeoObject. There are the following types (keys) of attributes predefined in CADability, which can be set with this method:
"Layer": sets a
"ColorDef": sets a
"LineWidth": sets a
"LinePattern": sets a
"HatchStyle": sets a
"DimensionStyle": sets a
"Style": sets a
Other attributes may be provided by the user.
member.param: key or typename of attribute to set

"Layer": sets a
"ColorDef": sets a
"LineWidth": sets a
"LinePattern": sets a
"HatchStyle": sets a
"DimensionStyle": sets a
"Style": sets a
Other attributes may be provided by the user.
member.param: key or typename of the required attribute

member.summary: This method will be called from a background thread when a higher precision displaylist is needed. The object should do all the necessary calculation to produce a display list with the required precision. The display list will later be acquired by a call to PaintTo3DList (or PaintTo3D) from the main thred because the display dirvers are not multithread enabled.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.GeoObjectList.ReduceToOwner
member.summary: A GeoObjectList is reduced to the owners of the contained objects. I.e. when an object has an owner of type IGeoObject (like a child of a ), it is removed from the list and the owner is added instead. As a result, the list contains only objects that are owned by a or don't have an owner at all.

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D
member.summary: A class with static methods to create and combine s, s or s.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.MakeOffset(CADability.GeoObject.Solid,System.Double)
member.summary: PRELIMINARY: Creates a solid as an offset to the provided . Positiv values for expand the solid, negative values contract it. Might be changed in future, especially the result will be an array, because contracting might produce several solids.
member.returns: The resulting solid

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.MakeRevolution(CADability.GeoObject.IGeoObject,CADability.GeoPoint,CADability.GeoVector,System.Double,CADability.Project)
member.summary: Creates a , a or a by rotating a , a or a around a given axis. Rotating a path yields a shell, rotating a face or a shell returns a . Rotating a different type of returns null.
member.param: amount to rotate (2*Math.PI is a full rotation)
the to set default styles for the result
member.returns: the created solid or shell

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.MakePrismMiter(CADability.Shapes.SimpleShape,CADability.GeoPoint,CADability.GeoVector,CADability.GeoVector,CADability.GeoVector,CADability.GeoVector)
member.summary: Creates a prism or profile as an extrusion of the provided shape. The position of the prism is defined by location and mainDirection. The shape is a 2D object. The 2d origin is moved along the axis defined by location and main direction. The topDirection vector corresponds to the 2d y-axis of the shape. The beginning and ending of the extrusion is a miter cut that allows the same profile be conected to the starting or ending point where mainDirection and startMiter are exchanged and topDirection is kept.
member.param: 2d shape to be extruded, the 2d origin is moved along mainDirection
Starting point of the resulting profile, corresponds to the 2d origin
The "up" direction fo the resulting profile, corresponds to the y-axis of the 2d shape
Direction of the prism, the length of this vector defines the length of the prism
Direction of the connectiong profile at the starting point
Direction of the connecting profile at the ending point
member.returns: The resulting solid

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.MakePrism(CADability.GeoObject.IGeoObject,CADability.GeoVector,CADability.Project,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a , a or a by moving a , a or a along a given vector. Moving a path yields a face or a shell, moving a face or a shell returns a . Moving a different type of returns null.
member.param: vector along which the object is to be moved
the to set default styles for the result
member.returns: the created solid, face or shell

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.Union(CADability.GeoObject.Solid,CADability.GeoObject.Solid)
member.summary: Returns the union of the two given s. If the solids are disjunct, null will be returned
member.returns: union of the two solids or null

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.Difference(CADability.GeoObject.Solid,CADability.GeoObject.Solid)
member.summary: Returns the difference of the two given s. If the solids are disjunct, null will be returned. s2 will be subtracted from s1.
member.returns: difference of the two solids or null

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.Difference(CADability.GeoObject.Shell,CADability.GeoObject.Solid)
member.summary: Returns the remains of a shell when a solid is subtracted.
member.returns: One ore more shells

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.Difference(CADability.GeoObject.Face,CADability.GeoObject.Solid)
member.summary: Returns the remains of a face when a solid is subtracted.
member.returns: One ore more faces

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.MakeRuledSolid(CADability.GeoObject.Path,CADability.GeoObject.Path,CADability.Project)
member.summary: Connects the two wires with a ruled surface. The two wires must have the same number of segments. Each segment of the first path is connected with the segment with the same index of the second path. Both pathes must be closed. A solid is returned bound by the faces of the two pathes and the ruled surfaces. If there is an error null will be returned
member.returns: the generated solid or null

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.MakeRuledShell(CADability.GeoObject.Path,CADability.GeoObject.Path,CADability.Project)
member.summary: Connects the two wires with a ruled surface. The two wires must have the same number of segments. Each segment of the first path is connected with the segment with the same index of the second path. The pathes may be open or closed. the ruled surfaces will be returned as a shell. If there is an error null will be returned
member.returns: the generated shell or null

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.ExtrudeCurveToFace(CADability.GeoObject.ICurve,CADability.GeoObject.ICurve)
member.summary: Extrude a curve along another curve. E.g. if you extrude a circle along a line (which is perpendicular to the cirle plane) you will get a cylindrical face. If the curve is planar, the curve will be only rotated around the plane's normal (and moved of course), If the curve is not planar, there is no well difined way how to rotate the curve .

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.MakeHelicalSolid(CADability.GeoPoint2D,CADability.GeoVector2D,CADability.Plane,CADability.Curve2D.Path2D,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a Solid by winding the closed path around the axis. The axisDirection also specifies the pitch

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.MakeHelicalSolid(CADability.GeoPoint2D,CADability.Plane,CADability.Curve2D.Path2D,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a thred (screw) from a profile (path) and a point in a plane. The path must be open and the pitch and direction is determined by the start- and endpoint of the path. The radius of the thread is the distance of the axisLocation to the connection of start- and enpoints of the path. Cylindrical segments form the start and endcaps.
member.param: Location of the axis in the plane
The plane, in which path and axisLocation are defined
member.returns: A Solid with the thread

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.SewFacesAndShells(CADability.GeoObject.GeoObjectList)
member.summary: Takes all faces and shells from the given list and tries to sew them together. When two or more faces have common edges they are connected to shells. Shells with no free edges are converted to solids.
member.returns: resulting objects

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.Intersection(CADability.GeoObject.Solid,CADability.GeoObject.Solid)
member.summary: Returns the intersection of the two given s. If the solids are disjunct, null will be returned. s1 and s2 will be intersected, the common solid is returned, which may consist of several solids
member.returns: intersection of the two solids or null

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.MakeCone(CADability.GeoPoint,CADability.GeoVector,CADability.GeoVector,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a cone. The cone is defined by two parallel discs with two different radii. The first disc is centered at location, the second at location + directionZ. directionZ is also the normal vector of both discs. directionX must be perpendicular to directionZ and specifies the startpoint of the circular edge.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.ExtrudeCurveToFace(CADability.GeoObject.ICurve,CADability.GeoVector,CADability.Edge,CADability.Edge,CADability.Edge,CADability.Edge,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: INTERN! Macht aus einer Kurve und einer Richtung ein Face. Es entstehen 4 Edges: 0: die Kurve curve selbst, 1: Endpunkt der Kurve plus extrusion, 2: versetzte rükwärtige Kurve, 3: inverse zu 1, endet am Startpunkt von curve. Evtl. können einige der Edges bereits existieren und sollen dann verwendet werden, so spart man sich das nachträgliche zusammenfügen einzelner Faces zu einer Shell. Die Parameter forward0 bis forward3 geben an, ob die 3D Kurve in der Edge die richtige Richtung hat oder nicht.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Make3D.Extrude(CADability.GeoObject.IGeoObject,CADability.GeoVector,CADability.Project)
member.summary: Extrudes the provided object along the .
member.param: Object to extrude, may be a , , or object
A project which is used to set default attributes to the result, may be null
member.returns: The extruded face, shell or solid, null if extrusion not possible

member.summary: Checks whether the two provided solids have overlapping faces. If this is the case, one of the two faces or both faces are split in a way that the modified solids have common, identical faces which have the same outlines
member.returns: Returns true if common overlapping faces were found.

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.Path
member.summary: A geoobject, that derives from Block and represents a ordered collection of geoobjects which all support the ICurve intrface. The contained curves are connected, i.e. Child(i).EndPoint is equal or close to Child(i+1).StartPoint. The Path is not necessary planar, closed and may be self intersecting.

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.Path.ModificationMode.keepAngle
member.summary: when modifying a point keeps the angle between the two connected curves

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.Path.ModificationMode.keepArcRatio
member.summary: keeps the ratio of the two radii of an ellipse, i.e. a circular ellipse will stay circular

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Path.CreateFromModel(CADability.GeoObject.ICurve,CADability.Model,CADability.Projection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a Path containing the curve BeginWith and other curves from the projectedModel. The curve BeginWith is checked at both ends to find connected objects. The search is stopped if there are nore more connected objects. The curves are clones and are tagged with objects with the name key "CADability.Path.Original" and the original object as the value. If flatten is true, UserData will be lost.
member.param: true: flatten the result, false: result not flattened
member.returns: The path or null if no cennecting objects found

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Path.CreateFromModel(CADability.GeoObject.ICurve,CADability.Model,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a Path containing the curve BeginWith and other curves from the Model. The curve BeginWith is checked at both ends to find connected objects. The search is stopped when there are nore more connected objects. The curves are clones and are tagged with objects with the name key "CADability.Path.Original" and the original object as the value. If flatten is true, UserData will be lost.
member.param: the model to search for connecting curves
true: flatten the result, false: result not flattened
member.returns: The path or null if no cennecting objects found

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Path.Set(CADability.GeoObject.GeoObjectList,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Takes a list of unsorted and unoriented geoobjects and tries to put them together to a connected path. All previously contained segments are removed. All objects of the list, that are used in this path will be removed from their owner (see ). To avoid objects bee removed from their owner (e.g. or ) use a list of cloned GeoObjects ().
member.param: if true, the path must consist of more than one curve
member.returns: success

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Path.Set(CADability.GeoObject.ICurve[])
member.summary: Makes this path represent the given list if all objects in that list are properly oriented and connected. If the objects do not connect, false will be returned and this path remains unchanged.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Path.Flatten
member.summary: Flattens this path. All subcurves that are composed of simple curves are decomposed into simpler curves (e.g. a polyline is decomposed into lines)

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Path.Add(CADability.GeoObject.ICurve)
member.summary: Adds a curve to this path. It is checked whether the curve to add can be connected to the start or endpoint of this path. If necessary the curve will be reversed. If it cannot be connected false will be returned.
member.returns: true on success, false on failure

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Path.Clear
member.summary: Removes all subcurves, the Path will be empty. Use this before modifying contained objects of this path because it is not allowed to mdify an object in a path in a way that would compromise the consitence of the path

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Path.Decompose
member.summary: Overrides

member.param: Max. length of subcurves to remove

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Path.BestCyclicalPosition(CADability.GeoObject.Path)
member.summary: Assumes both this and toThis are closed Paths with the same number of segments. Changes this Path to start with the segment where the distance of corresponding vertices is minimal. The geometry of this curve will not be changed
member.returns: true, if condition is satisfied

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Path.InsertPoint(System.Double)
member.summary: Splits the curve of this path that contains the provided position. If position is exactely on the connection of two subcurves, the path remains unchanged. Otherwise the curve containing the position is split and both curves are added to the path
member.param: Where to split, must be inbetween 0 and 1

member.summary: Checks whether the shall is closed, i.e. all edges of all faces connect two faces of this shell.

member.summary: Preliminary: Returns the enclosed part of the shell which is inside the border

member.summary: Removes the provided from the shell. Connecting edges are seperated
