member.summary: Adjacent faces that share a common surface are replaced by a single face
member.returns: Number of faces that have been combined

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Shell.SameForm(CADability.GeoObject.Shell,System.Double,CADability.ModOp@)
member.summary: Returns true, if this shell and the other shell describe the same form. The two shells may be at different positions in 3d space, but may not be rotated, i.e. must have the same orientation in 3d space.
member.param: maximum difference in the geometry of the two shells accepted as still beeing equal
how to move the other shell to coincide with this shell

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Shell.FindSameForm(CADability.GeoObject.Face[],System.Double,CADability.GeoObject.Shell.FindSameFormSearchMode)
member.summary: Find other instances of the "form" given by the parameter form. The faces in form must be a subset of faces of this shell. Returned are other subsets of faces of this shell that describe the same form.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Shell.FeatureFromFace(CADability.GeoObject.Face)
member.summary: Tries to find a feature like a drill hole or a part sticking out of the shell starting with this face. The rule is that faces connected with the face toStartWith are combined until the open edges have the same underlying surface. There might be one or two loops of such open edges (two loops for a hole going through the body).

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Shell.FeatureFromEdges(CADability.Edge[],CADability.GeoObject.Face[])
member.summary: edgeLoop must be a closed set of edges on this shell. The shell will be splitted at this loop. All edges in edgeLoop join one of the faces in facesToCutoff. These parts of the shell will not be used. At this loop, which remains open in the first step, the resulting shell will be closed by faces with surfaces from facesToCutOff.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Shell.GetContextMenu(CADability.IFrame)
member.summary: Returns a menu, which is shown when there is a right click on the face

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder
member.summary: Ths class serves as a parameter to . It keeps the best snappoint, the object, which caused it and the distance to the mouse point.

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SnapModes
member.summary: Snap modes to specify in which points the SnapPointFinder should respect

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SnapModes.SnapToIntersectionPoint
member.summary: Snap to intersection points of curves.

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SnapModes.SnapToDropPoint
member.summary: Snap to the perpendicular foot point from the basepoint. A basepoint is required.

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SnapModes.SnapToObjectPoint
member.summary: Snap to any point on the object, may be some intermediate point on the object.

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SnapModes.SnapToObjectSnapPoint
member.summary: Snap to a specifically qualified point on the object, usually start or endpoint, centerpoint depending on the kind of object.

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SnapModes.SnapToObjectCenter
member.summary: Snap to the center of the object under the cursor.

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SnapModes.SnapToTangentPoint
member.summary: Snap to a tangent point of the object under the cursor. A basepoint must be defined from which the tangent line starts.

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SnapModes.SnapToGridPoint
member.summary: Snap to a grid point. This has lower priority than the other snap operations.

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SnapModes.AdjustOrtho
member.summary: Snap to a point horizontally or vertically adjusted to the basepoint. A basepoint is required in this maode.

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SnapModes.SnapToZero
member.summary: Snap to the absolute origin of the coordinatesystem or drawing plane.

member.name: F:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SnapModes.SnapToFaceSurface
member.summary: Snap to any point on the surface of the Face under the cursor.

member.summary: caused the snapping.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.SourcePoint3D
member.value: Gets the source point (which is the mouse position on the projection plane) as a 3D point. Together with the direction of the projection this makes a line that is perpendicular to the screen and goes through the mouse point.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.Check(CADability.GeoPoint,CADability.GeoObject.IGeoObject,CADability.GeoObject.SnapPointFinder.DidSnapModes)
member.summary: The obj offers the point p as a snappoint in the given mode. This method checks whether to use this point as the closest snap point. This method is typically called by GeoObjects from the method.

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.Solid
member.summary: A Solid is a implementation that represents a solid body. Its main data is a collection of oriented faces. The normal vector on any point of the face points to the outside of the body. Solids have one set of faces that represent the outer hull and any number of cavyties that reside totally inside the outer hull. All cavyties are disjoint.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Solid.Edges
member.summary: Returns all the edges of this Shell. Each egde is unique in the array but may belong to two different faces.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Solid.Shells
member.summary: Returns a list of all shells that bound this solid. In most cases there is only a single shell. If there is more than one shell the shell with index 0 is the outer hull and all subsequent shells describe cavyties that reside totally inside the outer hull.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Solid.Name
member.summary: The name of the solid.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Solid.GetPlaneIntersection(CADability.GeoObject.PlaneSurface)
member.summary: Returns the curves that result from a planar intersection of this shell with the provided plane. The curves are properly clipped.
member.returns: Array of intersection curves

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface
member.summary: The ISurface interface must be implemented by all 3-dimensional unbound surfaces that are used by the object. The surface has a well defined 2-dimensional coordinate system, usually referred to as the u/v system.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetModified(CADability.ModOp)
member.summary: Returns a clone of this surface modified by the given ModOp.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.Make3dCurve(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D)
member.summary: Returns a 3-dimensional curve from the given 2-dimensional curve. the 2-dimensional curve is interpreted in the u/v system of the surface.
member.returns: corresponding 3-d curve

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetNormal(CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Returns the normal vector (perpendicular to the surface) at the given u/v point
member.returns: normal vector

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.UDirection(CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Returns the direction at the given u/v point in direction of the u-axis
member.returns: direction

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.VDirection(CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Returns the direction at the given u/v point in direction of the v-axis
member.returns: direction

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.PointAt(CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Returns the 3-dimensional point at the given u/v point
member.returns: point

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.PositionOf(CADability.GeoPoint)
member.summary: Returns the u/v position of the given point. It is assumed that the point is on the surface, if not the result is undetermined.
member.returns: position

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.DerivationAt(CADability.GeoPoint2D,CADability.GeoPoint@,CADability.GeoVector@,CADability.GeoVector@)
member.summary: Returns the point and the two derivations of the suface in a single call. It returns the same result as calling , und succesively but is often faster than the three seperate calls.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.Derivation2At(CADability.GeoPoint2D,CADability.GeoPoint@,CADability.GeoVector@,CADability.GeoVector@,CADability.GeoVector@,CADability.GeoVector@,CADability.GeoVector@)
member.summary: Returns the point, the two first derivations and the three second derivations of the surface at the provided parameter position.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetPlaneIntersection(CADability.GeoObject.PlaneSurface,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the intersection curve(s) of this surface with the given plane. An empty array is returned if there is no intersection. umin, umax, vmin, vmax define the Parameterspace of this surface (not of the PlaneSurface) for the intersection. It is also the periodic domain in which the 2d curve for this surface will be returned, if this surface is periodic. the resulting curves may exceed the area provided by umin, umax, vmin, vmax.
member.returns: intersection curves

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetTangentCurves(CADability.GeoVector,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns curves where direction is perpendicular to the normal vector

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetSafeParameterSteps(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Gets spans of the parameterspace that are guaranteed to contain only one inflection point. The returned intu should contain umin as first and umax as last value (same with v)

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.IsVanishingProjection(CADability.Projection,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns true if the given projection makes the surface disappear, i.e. degenerate to an edge.
member.returns: true if vanishing, falso otherwise

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetLineIntersection(CADability.GeoPoint,CADability.GeoVector)
member.summary: Returns the intersectionpoints of this surface with the line given by the parameters. Teh returned point are in the parametric (u/v) space of this surface.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.IsUPeriodic
member.summary: Returns true, if this surface is periodic in the u direction (e.g. a cylinder) false otherwise.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.IsVPeriodic
member.summary: Returns true, if this surface is periodic in the v direction (e.g. a torus) false otherwise.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.UPeriod
member.summary: Returns the u priod of this surface if it is u periodic 0.0 otherwise

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.VPeriod
member.summary: Returns the v priod of this surface if it is v periodic 0.0 otherwise

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetUSingularities
member.summary: returns the values for the u parameter where this surface is singular i.e. changing v with this u parameter fixed doesn't change the 3D point.
member.returns: list of u singularities

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetVSingularities
member.summary: returns the values for the v parameter where this surface is singular i.e. changing u with this v parameter fixed doesn't change the 3D point.
member.returns: list of v singularities

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.MakeFace(CADability.Shapes.SimpleShape)
member.summary: Makes a from this surface with the given bounds in the parametric (u/v) space.
member.returns: the created face or null

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetZMinMax(CADability.Projection,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the minimum and maximumm valus for the z-coordinate of a rectangular patch (in parametric space) of this surface under a certain projection
member.param: left bound of the rectangular patch
right bound of the rectangular patch
bottom bound of the rectangular patch
top bound of the rectangular patch

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.MakeCanonicalForm
member.summary: Modifies this surface into a more canonical form and returns the modification for the parametric space which reverses this modification in 2d. Curves in the parametric space of this surface will become invalid unless modified by the returned transformation.
member.returns: 2d modification for the parametric space

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.Clone
member.summary: Returns an identical but independant copy of this surface

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.Modify(CADability.ModOp)
member.summary: Modifies this surface with the given operation

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.CopyData(CADability.GeoObject.ISurface)
member.summary: Copies the data of the given surface to this surface. The two surfaces are guaranteed to be of the same type. (Used after and to restore the original values).
member.param: where to copy the data from

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.Approximate(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Create a NurbSurface as an approximation of this surface

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetProjectedCurve(CADability.GeoObject.ICurve,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the projection of the given curve in 2D coordinates. Should only be used for curves that are close to the surface.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.Intersect(CADability.GeoObject.ICurve,CADability.BoundingRect,CADability.GeoPoint[]@,CADability.GeoPoint2D[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary: Returns the intersection of the provided with this surface. The result may be empty.
member.param: The curve to be intersected with
u/v values of the intersection points on this surface
u parameter of intersection points on the curve

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.Intersect(CADability.BoundingRect,CADability.GeoObject.ISurface,CADability.BoundingRect)
member.summary: Returns the intersection curves between this surface and the provided other surface. Both surfaces are bound by rectangles.
member.returns: Array of intersection curves

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.ReverseOrientation
member.summary: Reverses the orientation of this surface. The normal vector will point to the other side after this operation. The returned determins how (u,v) coordinates of the parameter space have to be transformed to define the same 3d point.
member.returns: Transformation of the parameter space

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.SameGeometry(CADability.BoundingRect,CADability.GeoObject.ISurface,CADability.BoundingRect,System.Double,CADability.ModOp2D@)
member.summary: Returns true if this surface and the other surface are geometrically identical, i.e. describe the same surface in 3D space. The may have a different u/v system. The returned contains the ModOp to convert from the u/v system of the first surface to the second surface.
member.returns: True if the surfaces are geometrically equal

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetOffsetSurface(System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a surface that is "parallel" to this surface, i.e. each point on this surface corresponds a point on the returned surface that has the same (u,v) coordinates and has the 3d coordinates oft the point plus offset*Normal at this point
member.returns: The offset surface

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetNaturalBounds(System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Returns the natural bounds of the surface. The returned values may be infinite

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.HitTest(CADability.BoundingCube,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Checks whether this surface restricted by the provided parameters interferes with the provided cube.
member.returns: true if the cube and the surface interfere

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.HitTest(CADability.BoundingCube,CADability.GeoPoint2D@)
member.summary: Returns true, if this surface interferes with the provided cube. If this is the case uv will contain a point (in the parameter system of the surface) which is inside the cube

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.Oriented
member.summary: Returns true, if this surface divides the space into two parts. If the surfaces is Oriented returns a valid result

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.Orientation(CADability.GeoPoint)
member.summary: Returns the orientation of the provided point. The sign of the result may be used to distinguish between inside and outside.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetExtrema
member.summary: Returns an array of points in parametric space where there are extrema in direction of x-, y- or z-axis. The normal vector in a extremum is parallel to one of the axis and the surface has a relative maximum or minimum in this direction.
member.returns: s.a.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetPatchExtent(CADability.BoundingRect,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the extent of a patch of the surface clipped rectangular in the 2d parameter space

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.FixedU(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a curve where the u parameter of this surface is fixed and the v parameter starts a vmin and ends at vmax

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.FixedV(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a curve where the v parameter of this surface is fixed and the u parameter starts a umin and ends at umax

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.SetBounds(CADability.BoundingRect)
member.summary: Mostly used internally

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.PerpendicularFoot(CADability.GeoPoint)
member.summary: Returns a list of perpendicular foot points of the surface. The list may be empty
member.param: Source point for the perpendicular foot
member.returns: Array of footpoints, may be empty

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetNonPeriodicSurface(CADability.Shapes.Border)
member.summary: If this surface is periodic in u or v or both return a nonperiodic surface which describes the same geometric surface but with a differen parametric system.
member.param: Maximum area in which the definition must be valid

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.GetPatchHull(CADability.BoundingRect,CADability.GeoPoint@,CADability.GeoVector@,CADability.GeoVector@,CADability.GeoVector@)
member.summary: Returns a parallelepiped (a prism with parallelograms) defined by the parameters , , , which completeley covers or encloses the patch of the surface defined by the . There are obviously many solutions to this problem but a parallelepiped with minimum volume would be preferred. This method is used to optimate intersection algorithms.
member.param: The patch of the surface in parametric space
One of the three vectors of the parallelepiped
One of the three vectors of the parallelepiped
One of the three vectors of the parallelepiped

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.ISurface.IsRuled
member.summary: returns wheather the surface is linear in u or v direction

member.summary: used internally. the maximum distance of the 3d curve, formed by the uv-line from sp to ep, to the 3d-line from PointAt(sp) to PointAt(ep)
member.param: The uv point where this distance occurres

member.summary: Returns the intersection curves between this surface and the provided other surface. Both surfaces are bound by rectangles.

member.summary: Returns a simpler form of this surface: SurfaceOfLinearExtrusion might be a cylinder, NURBS might be a sphere etc. Returns null, if there is no simpler form

member.summary: Find positions on the surface and on the curve where the connection of these points are perpendicular to the surface and to the curve

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.ISurfaceImpl
member.summary: Internal helper class for implementation.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.ISurfaceImpl.CurveToHelper(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D)
member.summary: Kann sein, dass der Helper nicht den selben ParameterSpace hat wie das ISurface Objekt. z.B. eine verzerrte Ebene geht halt in opencascade nicht. Schlimmer noch bei verzerrten Kreisen (Zylinder, Kegel, Torus, Kugel, extrusion): dort kann man die Oberfläche zwar exakt mit NURBS annähern, aber die Kurven sind i.a. nicht mehr linear auf der NURBS-Fläche verzerrt. Dort muss man die Kurven vollkommen neu erzeugen ACHTUNG!! immer erst Helper (get) aufrufen und dann GetHelperCurve, denn in Helper wird oft erst die Modop oder andere Daten für GetHelperCurve berechnet.

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.BoxedSurface
member.summary: Ein Klasse, die ein Surface Objekt mit Würfeln einhüllt: Jeder Patch hat einen BoundingCube. Alle BoundingCubes sind in einem OctTree enthalten. Wenn ein Würfelchen verkleinert werden muss, dann wird es aus dem OctTree entfernt und die kleinen werden eingefügt. Die Würfelchen können sich überlappen

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.BoxedSurface.HitTest(CADability.BoundingCube,CADability.GeoPoint2D@)
member.summary: Stellt fest, ob die Fläche von dem BoundingCube getroffen wird und wenn ja liefert es einen inneren Flächenpunkt zurück. Der OctTree wird bei deiser Gelegenheit u.U. verfeinert

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.BoxedSurfaceEx
member.summary: Ein Klasse, die ein Surface Objekt mit Würfeln einhüllt: Jeder Patch hat einen BoundingCube. Alle BoundingCubes sind in einem OctTree enthalten. Wenn ein Würfelchen verkleinert werden muss, dann wird es aus dem OctTree entfernt und die kleinen werden eingefügt. Die Würfelchen können sich überlappen

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.BoxedSurfaceEx.ParEpi.PositionOf(CADability.GeoPoint,CADability.GeoObject.ISurface)
member.summary: Fast calculation for a starting position for a PositionOf for the provided surface and a 3d point p3d, of which the position is queried. Uses a weak reference to a matrix, which is calculated on the first call or when it has been claimed by GC

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.BoxedSurfaceEx.HitTest(CADability.BoundingCube,CADability.GeoPoint2D@)
member.summary: Determins, whether the surface is hit by the provided bounding cube, and if so returns an arbitrary point of the surface. Problem: we would need several points, if there are more disjunct surface segments which interfere with the cube

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.BoxedSurfaceEx.findMaxPlaneDist(CADability.GeoPoint2D,CADability.GeoPoint2D,CADability.GeoVector,CADability.GeoPoint2D@)
member.summary: Finde die Stelle mit maximalen oder minimalen Abstand der Kurve (gegeben durch die Strecke [sp, ep] in uv) zu der gegebenen Ebene (norm) Die Ebene geht gewöhnlich durch die beiden Punkte bei sp und ep, dann gibt es immer ein dazwischenliegendes Maximum.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.BoxedSurfaceEx.findMaxPlaneDist(CADability.GeoPoint2D,System.Double,CADability.GeoVector,CADability.GeoPoint2D@)
member.summary: Newton Verfahren zum Finden eines Maximums für eine gegebene Richtung, von einem (u,v) Punkt ausgehend Es wird ein Polynom 2. Grades in u und v in diesem Punkt erzeugt, dessen 1. und 2. Ableitungen mit der Fläche übereinstimmen, das also die Fläche in diesem Punkt approximiert. Für dieses Polynom kann einfach das maximum in diese Richtung gefunden werden (2 lineare Gleichungen, so dass diru und dirv senkrecht zu gegebenen Rictung stehen) Dieser (u,v) Punkt wird auf die Fläche übertragen für den nächsten Iterationsschritt.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.BoxedSurfaceEx.PositionOf(CADability.GeoPoint,CADability.GeoObject.BoxedSurfaceEx.ParEpi,CADability.GeoPoint2D@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Newton approximation of footpoint of p3d on this path of the surface.

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.SurfaceOfLinearExtrusion
member.summary: Surface defined by a 3d curve and a direction. A point at (u,v) of the surface is defined by the point of the curve at parameter u plus v*direction. It is the surface that is generated by the curve moved along the direction. The curve may not have the direction as a tangential vector. Also the curve is defined in the interval [0,1], the parameterspace of this curve may also be defined by a startParameter and an endParameter.

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Text.SetBounds(CADability.GeoPoint,CADability.GeoPoint,CADability.GeoPoint)
member.summary: Modifies the direction, size and aspect ratio of the text so that the text will fit inside the parallelogram defined by the provided parameters.
member.param: Point for the lower left position of the text
Point for the lower right position of the text
Point for the upper left position of the text

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Text.GetOutline
member.summary: Returns a list of objects that define the outline (and holes) of this text. The global setting "Font.Precision" defines the precision of the outline, if the precision is 3 (fine) then splines can occur in the outline. If the precision is 1 or 2 (raw, middle) the splines are approximated.
member.returns: List of curves describing the outline of this text object

member.name: M:CADability.GeoObject.Text.GetShapes
member.summary: Returns the shapes of all characters of this text. The characters are appropriatly spaced, but the text size and glyphdirection is not taken into account

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.Alignment
member.summary: Sets or gets the horizontal (or in direction of ) alignement of the text.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.LineAlignment
member.summary: Sets or gets the vertical alignement of the text.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.LineDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the line direction of the text. Default is . Setting the line direction does not modify the of the text, so you usually will have to change both. It also affects the aspect ratio of the text, which is defined by the length of the line direction and the length of the glyph direction. To simply rotate a text better use with a rotation.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.GlyphDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the vertical character parts. This direction is usually perpendicular to the , but can be modified to produce italic characters of any angle. The property in contrary uses the typefont italic capabilities which are more sophisticated.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the text. The value of this point is interpreted according to the values of the and properties.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.Bold
member.summary: Gets or sets the bold property of the text font.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.Italic
member.summary: Gets or sets the italic property of the text font.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.Underline

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.Strikeout

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.TextString
member.summary: Gets or sets the text string that is displayed with this object.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the font used for this text object

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.TextSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of this text object.

member.name: P:CADability.GeoObject.Text.GlyphAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle of the characters vertical direction in respect to the horizontal direction. The default value is 90°, different angles create different italic fonts.

member.name: T:CADability.GeoObject.UnscaledGeoObject
member.summary: A GeoObject which always appears in the same size in a view. It is not scaled when the view is zoomed. These objects can not be kept in displaylists and hence have a poor performance when used in high numbers. The objects rotate with the view when viewed from different directions. The specifies the position of the origin (GeoPoint(0,0,0)) of the referenced GeoObject. Usually you would center the referenced object at the origin so this object will be centered at the . In contrast to the object, which always shows its face to the viewer and is much faster, because it can be kept in the display list. Since this object does not have a well defined size in world coordinates, it is only pickable or selectable at its insertion point. The size of the object is assumed in device units (pixels) The Layer of this object will be taken into account for the objects visibility, not the layer of the referenced object. The use of this object is not recommended because it has a poor performance in both display and selection. Consider using instead.

member.name: T:CADability.Shapes.Border
member.summary: A simple border composed of one ore more ICurve2D objects. A Border is always invariant, i.e. you annot change it (like System.String). If a border is closed, then it is oriented counterclockwise. A border may be produced by the BorderBuilder object (or by its constructors).

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.#ctor(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D[])
member.summary: Constructs a Border from a list of ICurve2D objects. The objects must be in the correct order and must be continous, i.e. EndPoint of ICurve2D[i] must be equal to Startpoint of ICurve2D[i+1]. Equality refers to Precision.IsEqual(). It will be checked automatically, whether the border is closed and if so, it will be oriented counterclockwise.
member.param: list of curves to make the border

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.#ctor(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a border with the provided segments assumed to be in correct order and orientation. If is true, the border will be closed.
member.param: True: border will be closed even if segments aren't connected at the end

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.FromUnorientedList(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: segments enthält die Kurven zwar in richtiger Reohenfolge doch u.U. in falscher Richtung. Hier wird also vor dem Erzeugen der Border ggf. umorientiert

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.FromOrientedList(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Für BrepIntersection brauchen wir unveränderte Orientierung und einen entsprechenden "Innen-/Außen-begriff"

member.name: T:CADability.Shapes.Border.Position
member.summary: Position of a point or boundingrectangle relative to a border. Inside: the point or rectangle is completely inside the border, Outside: the point or rectangle is completely outside the border, OnCurve: the point or rectangle is on the outline of the border.

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.GetPosition(CADability.BoundingRect)
member.summary: Returns the of the given Point relative to this Border. If the outline of the border interferes with a square around p (width and height is 2*precision), the result will be OnCurve.
member.param: The "radius" (half width) of a square centered at p
member.returns: Inside, Outside or OnCurve (on the outline of this border)

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.GetPosition(CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Returns the of the given Point relative to this Border.
member.returns: Inside, Outside or OnCurve (on the outline of this border)

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.IsInside(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D[],CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Returnes true, when the provided point is inside the loop of curves. When the curves are oriented clockwise, true means outside (the hole)

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.GetIntersectionPoints(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D)
member.summary: Returns a list of all intersectionpoints of this border with the given curve. Some intersectionpoints may be found twice, if the Curve passes through a vertex of this border. The par1 member of the intersectionpoint is the parameter of this border (0.0<=par1<=this.Count) the par2 member is the parameter of the curve (0.0<=par1<=1.0).
member.param: curve to intersect this border with
member.returns: list of intersection points

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.Split(System.Double[])
member.summary: Returns an array of Border objects by breaking this border at the given positions. Parameter must be an ordered list of double values. Each value must be greater 0.0 and less the number of iCurve2D objects in this Border.

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.Split(System.Double[],CADability.GeoPoint2D[],System.Double[])
member.summary: Identisch mit Split weiter oben, jedoch werden die Punkte noch nachgebessert durch die gegebenen GeoPoint2D

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.GetParameter(CADability.GeoPoint2D)
member.summary: Liefert den Parameter des Punktes p auf den Bahnkurven des Borders. Für jede Kurve durchläuft der Parameter Werte von 0.0 (Startpunkt) bis 1.0 (Endpunkt) Das Ergebnis dieser Methode ist dieser Parameter + Index der betreffenden Kurve.
member.param: Punkt, zu dem der Parameter gesucht ist, muss auf dem Rand liegen
member.returns: der Parameter

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.op_Addition(CADability.Shapes.Border,CADability.Shapes.Border)
member.summary: Concatenates two border objects. Both borders must be open (not closed) and the endpoint of the first border must be equal to the startpoint of the second border (as defined by Precision.IsEqual).

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.GetParallel(System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Yields a set of borders that are parallel to this border with a given distance. Positive distance yields a border to the right side (or outside if closed) of this border, negative to the left side or inside. In some cases there is no soltuion (e.g. an inside parallel border of a closed border must have a distance less than half of the diameter of the border) In other cases there may be a set of solutions, e.g. if the border is not convex.
member.param: the distance of the desired parallel border
member.returns: array of parallel borders (maybe empty)

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.RemoveSmallSegments(System.Double)
member.summary: Removes small segments which are smaller than and connects the remaining segments.
member.param: Segments smaller than this value are beeing removed

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.AsPath
member.summary: Returns this Border as a object.

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.Border.DistanceAtDirection(CADability.Shapes.Border,CADability.GeoVector2D)
member.summary: Calculates the distance between this Border and the Border respecting the given direction . Or in other words: how far can you move this Border in the direction dir until it touches the other border. The result may be double.MaxValue, which means they will never touch each other or negative, if you would have to move this border in the opposite direction of dir.
member.param: The border to meassure the distance to
member.returns: Distance

member.summary: Klasse zum Erzeugen von Border Objekten.

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.BorderBuilder.AddSegment(CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D)
member.summary: Fügt das im Parameter gegebene Segment zu. ACHTUNG: die Methode BuildBorder dreht dieses Segment möglicherweise um. Wenn das nicht passieren darf, dann hier mit Clone arbeiten!

member.name: T:CADability.Shapes.BorderQuadTree.quad
member.summary: Für das Integer Koordinatensystem. Das hat den Zweck, Hash-Tabellen für horizontale und vertikale Schnitte zu ermöglichen und exakt gleiche Ergebnisse für die gemeinsame Seite eines Quadrates zu liefern, egal aus welchem Quadrat man rechnet. Die Breite der Quadrate ist imme eine Zweierpotenz. x, y und w sind immer positiv

member.name: T:CADability.Shapes.BorderQuadTree.Node
member.summary:
Ein Quadrat des Quadtrees, wenn nicht unterteilt, dann enthält es von jedem Border nur ein Segment mit definierten Eintritts und Austrittspunkt. Tangentiale Schnitte sind nicht erlaubt, dann muss der ganze Quadtree anders positioniert werden. Enthält maximal einen Schnittpunkt der beiden Border.
Integer Koordinatensystem: so kann man einfache Hash-Tabellen machen, in denen für horizontale und vertikale Linien die Schnittpunkte erfasst werden

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.BorderQuadTree.Node.Init
member.summary: Fügt die beiden Border in diesen Quadranten ein. Wenn es ein Problem gibt (tangentiale Schitte, Schnittpunkt der Border genau auf der Kante) dann wird false geliefet.

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.BorderQuadTree.Node.setInside(System.Boolean,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Setzt die fullInsideBdr1/2 für Quadrate, die die betreffende Border nicht enthalten

member.name: M:CADability.Shapes.BorderQuadTree.Node.collectIntervals(CADability.Shapes.BorderQuadTree.interval,CADability.Shapes.BorderQuadTree.interval,CADability.Shapes.BorderQuadTree.op)
member.summary: Sammelt die für die gegebene Operation relevanten Abschnitte der beiden Borders zusammen

member.name: T:CADability.Shapes.Joint
member.summary: Ein Verbindungspunkt. Die Kurve curve startet oder endet hier. Findet Verwendung im Cluster, der i.A. aus mehreren solchen Verbindungspunkten besteht.

member.name: T:CADability.Shapes.Cluster
member.summary: Ein oder mehrere Joints, die sehr end beisammenliegen und als identische Punkte betrachtet werden.

member.name: T:CADability.Shapes.CurveGraph

member.summary: A simply connected 2d shape. It consists of a outline and 0 or more holes. The holes don't overlap (disjunct) and reside totally inside the outline.

member.name: T:CADability.BRepRoundEdges
member.summary: Analog zu Border, jedoch nicht zwangsweise linksrum orientiert. Als innen wird alles betrachtet, was links von den Kurven liegt, also auch inverse Border möglich, die ein Loch im Unendlichen darstellen. Unveränderlich!

member.name: M:CADability.BRepRoundEdges.RoundEdge(CADability.Edge,System.Double,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D[]@,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D[]@,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D[]@,CADability.Curve2D.ICurve2D[]@,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a surface, which rounds the two faces of the provided edge with the given radius. The surface is correct oriented Also returns the two 2d curves on primary and secondary face of the edge, which define the tangential touching curve of the surface to the two faces. The orientation of the 2d curves is ccw, but the closing bounds at the open sides of the surfaces are not created. The surface returned is composed by up to 5 surfaces, which can be connected. The middle surface [2] is actually tangential to both surfaces of the edge. surfacee [1] is tangential to only one of the two surfaces, the other surface does not exist here. surface [0] is a cylindrical extension to exceed the faces by at least "radius" length. surface [3] and [4] are analogous at the end of the edge. If the rounding surface is a simple surface (cylindrical, toroidal) all segments are returned as one surface at index 2.

member.name: M:CADability.BRepRoundEdges.ExtrudeArc(CADability.GeoObject.ICurve,CADability.GeoVector,CADability.GeoVector,System.Double)
member.summary: Create a surface by moving an arc or circle along the provided curve. If the curve is a line or an circular arc, we get a cylindrical or toriodal surface, otherwise a GeneralSweptCurve is created.

member.name: T:CADability.StepEdgeDescriptor
member.summary: Describes an edge as imported from a step file. The edge may be decomposed into multiple edges for CADability faces in case of periodic faces.

member.name: T:CADability.Edge
member.summary: Edge is a abstract description of an egde on a . An Edge may belong to one or two faces. Edges don't exist without faces (use and derived classes for simple 3d curves). The Edge is defined in several ways, which are overdetermined and therfore must always be in a consistent state: It is the pur 3-dimensional curve, an , and on each Face the edge is defined as a 2-dimensional curve on the surface (see ), which has a 2-dimensional (u/v) coordinate system (parametric space). The Edge may be an outer or an inner edge on each face or some curve on the inside of a face (typically an outlining curve for a certain ). The edge may not be outside of a face.

member.name: T:CADability.Edge.EdgeKind
member.summary: Kind of the edge

member.name: F:CADability.Edge.EdgeKind.unknown
member.summary: Kind has not yet been determined

member.name: F:CADability.Edge.EdgeKind.projectionTangent
member.summary: An edge that is only used as a projection aid. It is the outline (contour, silhouette) of a face, not a real edge of a face

member.name: F:CADability.Edge.EdgeKind.singleOutline
member.summary: An edge that appears only on a single face and describes the outline of that face

member.name: F:CADability.Edge.EdgeKind.doubleSharp
member.summary: An edge that connects two faces and represents a sharp bend

member.name: F:CADability.Edge.EdgeKind.doubleSoft
member.summary: An edge that connects two faces and represents a tangential (soft) transition

member.name: F:CADability.Edge.EdgeKind.periodic
member.summary: An edge that connects a single periodic face

member.name: F:CADability.Edge.EdgeKind.excluded

member.summary: Returns a new edge whith a clone of the 3d curve, but null references to and .

member.name: M:CADability.Edge.Forward(CADability.GeoObject.Face)
member.summary: Checks the orientation of this edge. The curve of this edge () has a orientation ( and ). The corresponding 2d curves on the face are also oriented, so that seen from the outside the 2d curves are oriented counterclockwise. If the 3d curve orientation is the same as the 2d orientation on the provided face , then true is returned, otherwise false is returned.
member.param: Face, on which the orientation of the 3d curve is checked.
member.returns: true, if forward oriented, false otherwise

member.summary: Stellt fest, ob diese Edge teil einer anderen Edge ist. Das das über geometrische Eigenschaften läuft ist blöd, denn man könnte es besser beim Erzeugen (Face.Split) bestimmen, ist aber dort sehr umständlich

member.name: T:CADability.IFinishDeserialization
member.summary: [Deprecated], Implement this interface to receive the "DeserializationDone" callback after the object is deserialized. To receive this callback you also hav to add your object to the appropriate list by doing the following on the Constructor (SerializationInfo info, StreamingContext context): FinishDeserialization fd = context.Context as FinishDeserialization; if (fd!=null) fd.Add(this);

member.summary: Solves the Gauss Newton approximation with the given and the error function and Jacobi matrix as specified in the constructor. Returns the result in and returns true, if the error function of the result is less than . The iteration doesn't stop when is reached, but goes on until no more improvement of the result ocurres.

member.summary: p1,d1 and p2,d2 define two lines. Find a point on each line (s1,s2) so that the connection of these two points has the angle a1 to the first and a2 to the second line. a1 and a2 are provided as cosinus of the angles

member.name: T:CADability.StepEdgeCollection
member.summary: A collection of edges created in the course of reading a step file. Its purpose is to use the same edge for the use on the second face. And also to determin, when an edge had to be splitted into parts durng the import, to keep faces connected to the same edges. Find edge corresponding to two vertices and a 3d curve. There might be more than one edge connecting two vertices, that is why we need the curve. And the edge may have been splitted into two ore more subedges (as a result to periodic faces/surfaces)

member.summary: This event will be fired before multiple objects are beeing added. There is no sense in modifying the provided array of objects. There will be an additional call to and for each objects (where you can prevent the object beeing added) and a final call to .

member.name: E:CADability.Model.RemovingGeoObjectsEvent
member.summary: This event will be fired before multiple objects are beeing removed. There is no sense in modifying the provided array of objects. There will be an additional call to and for each objects (where you can prevent the object beeing added) and a final call to .

member.name: M:CADability.ModOp2D.Fit(CADability.GeoVector2D[],CADability.GeoVector2D[])
member.summary: Constructs a modification, that transforms the src vectors to the dst vectors. The length of src and dst must be 2. The resulting modification is any kind of an affinity, that projects the src vectors to the dst vectors. The origin (0,0) remains fixed.
member.returns: resulting transformation

member.name: M:CADability.ModOp2D.Fit(CADability.GeoPoint2D[],CADability.GeoPoint2D[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs a modification, that transforms the Src points to the Dst points. The length of Src and Dst must be equal and less than 4. If the length is 1, the resulting ModOp is a translation, if the length is 2, the parameter DoScale decides whether the resulting ModOp is a translation and rotation (DoScale==false) or translation, rotation and scaling (DoScale==true). If the length is 3, the resulting modification is any kind of an affinity, that projects the src points to the dst points.
member.param: scaling if two point pairs are given
member.returns: resulting transformation

member.summary: Creates the sub nodes for the provided node, which is about to be splitted. The standard implementation devides the extent of the node in half for each dimension and creates 2^dimension new nodes with the appropriate extents set. Override this method if you want the extent to be unevenly splitted or if you want to return fewer sub-nodes, which don't fill the eintire extent (because some part of the extent will not be used). No sub-node may exceed the extent of it's parent node.

summary.para: The MEMORYSTATUS structure contains information about the current state of both physical and virtual memory.
The function stores information in a MEMORYSTATUS structure.

remarks.para: MEMORYSTATUS reflects the state of memory at the time of the call. It reflects the size of the paging file at that time. The operating system can enlarge the paging file up to the maximum size set by the administrator.

On computers with more than 4 GB of memory, the MEMORYSTATUS structure can return incorrect information. Windows reports a value of -1 to indicate an overflow, while Windows NT reports a value that is the real amount of memory, modulo 4 GB. If your application is at risk for this behavior, use the GlobalMemoryStatusEx function instead of the function.

member.name: F:CADability.Kernel.SYSTEM_INFO.AllocationGranularity
member.summary: Granularity with which virtual memory is allocated. For example, a VirtualAlloc request to allocate 1 byte will reserve an address space of AllocationGranularity bytes. This value was hard coded as 64K in the past, but other hardware architectures may require different values.

summary.para: System's architecture-dependent processor level. It should be used only for display purposes. To determine the feature set of a processor, use the function.
If SystemInfoUnion.ProcessorArchitecture is , ProcessorLevel is defined by the CPU vendor.
If SystemInfoUnion.ProcessorArchitecture is , ProcessorLevel is set to 1.
If SystemInfoUnion.ProcessorArchitecture is , ProcessorLevel is of the form 00xx, where xx is an 8-bit implementation number (bits 8-15 of the PRId register). The member can be the following value:

item.description: MIPS R4000

summary.para: If SystemInfoUnion.ProcessorArchitecture is , ProcessorLevel is of the form xxxx, where xxxx is a 16-bit processor version number (the low-order 16 bits of a version number from the firmware). The member can be one of the following values:

item.description: Alpha 21064
Alpha 21066
Alpha 21164

summary.para: If SystemInfoUnion.ProcessorArchitecture is , ProcessorLevel is of the form xxxx, where xxxx is a 16-bit processor version number (the high-order 16 bits of the Processor Version Register). The member can be one of the following values:

item.description: PPC 601
PPC 603
PPC 604
PPC 603+
PPC 604+
PPC 620

summary.para: Architecture-dependent processor revision. The following table shows how the revision value is assembled for each type of processor architecture:

description.para: A value of the form xxyz.
If xx is equal to 0xFF, y - 0xA is the model number, and z is the stepping identifier. For example, an Intel 80486-D0 system returns 0xFFD0.
If xx is not equal to 0xFF, xx + 'A' is the stepping letter and yz is the minor stepping.
A value of the form xxyy, where xx is the model number and yy is the stepping. Display this value of 0x0201 as follows:

item.description: A value of the form 00xx, where xx is the 8-bit revision number of the processor (the low-order 8 bits of the PRId register).

description.para: A value of the form xxyy, where xxyy is the low-order 16 bits of the processor revision number from the firmware. Display this value as follows:
A value of the form xxyy, where xxyy is the low-order 16 bits of the processor version register. Display this value as follows:
