member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Algorithms.StablePartition``1(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Predicate{``0})
member.summary: Partition a list or array based on a predicate. After partitioning, all items for which the predicate returned true precede all items for which the predicate returned false. The partition is stable, which means that if items X and Y have the same result from the predicate, and X precedes Y in the original list, X will precede Y in the partitioned list.
member.remarks: Although arrays cast to IList<T> are normally read-only, this method will work correctly and modify an array passed as .
member.param: The list or array to partition.
A delegate that defines the partitioning condition.
member.returns: The index of the first item in the second half of the partition; i.e., the first item for which returned false. If the predicate was true for all items in the list, list.Count is returned.

member.name: T:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1
member.summary: Bag<T> is a collection that contains items of type T. Unlike a Set, duplicate items (items that compare equal to each other) are allowed in an Bag.

remarks.p: The items are compared in one of two ways. If T implements IComparable<T> then the Equals method of that interface will be used to compare items, otherwise the Equals method from Object will be used. Alternatively, an instance of IComparer<T> can be passed to the constructor to use to compare items.
Bag is implemented as a hash table. Inserting, deleting, and looking up an an element all are done in approximately constant time, regardless of the number of items in the bag.

When multiple equal items are stored in the bag, they are stored as a representative item and a count. If equal items can be distinguished, this may be noticable. For example, if a case-insensitive comparer is used with a Bag<string>, and both "hello", and "HELLO" are added to the bag, then the bag will appear to contain two copies of "hello" (the representative item).
is similar, but uses comparison instead of hashing, maintain the items in sorted order, and stores distinct copies of items that compare equal.

member.summary: Makes a shallow clone of this bag; i.e., if items of the bag are reference types, then they are not cloned. If T is a value type, then each element is copied as if by simple assignment.
member.remarks: Cloning the bag takes time O(N), where N is the number of items in the bag.
member.returns: The cloned bag.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.Clone
member.summary: Makes a shallow clone of this bag; i.e., if items of the bag are reference types, then they are not cloned. If T is a value type, then each element is copied as if by simple assignment.
member.remarks: Cloning the bag takes time O(N), where N is the number of unquie items in the bag.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.CloneContents
member.summary: Makes a deep clone of this bag. A new bag is created with a clone of each element of this bag, by calling ICloneable.Clone on each element. If T is a value type, then each element is copied as if by simple assignment.

remarks.para: If T is a reference type, it must implement ICloneable. Otherwise, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.
Cloning the bag takes time O(N log N), where N is the number of items in the bag.

member.returns: The cloned bag.
member.exception: T is a reference type that does not implement ICloneable.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that enumerates all the items in the bag. If an item is present multiple times in the bag, the representative item is yielded by the enumerator multiple times. The order of enumeration is haphazard and may change.

remarks.p: Typically, this method is not called directly. Instead the "foreach" statement is used to enumerate the items, which uses this method implicitly.
If an item is added to or deleted from the bag while it is being enumerated, then the enumeration will end with an InvalidOperationException.
Enumeration all the items in the bag takes time O(N), where N is the number of items in the bag.

member.returns: An enumerator for enumerating all the items in the Bag.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Determines if this bag contains an item equal to . The bag is not changed.
member.remarks: Searching the bag for an item takes time O(log N), where N is the number of items in the bag.
member.returns: True if the bag contains . False if the bag does not contain .

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.DistinctItems
member.summary: Enumerates all the items in the bag, but enumerates equal items just once, even if they occur multiple times in the bag.
member.remarks: If the bag is changed while items are being enumerated, the enumeration will terminate with an InvalidOperationException.
member.returns: An IEnumerable<T> that enumerates the unique items.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.Add(`0)
member.summary: Adds a new item to the bag. Since bags can contain duplicate items, the item is added even if the bag already contains an item equal to . In this case, the count of items for the representative item is increased by one, but the existing represetative item is unchanged.

remarks.para: Adding an item takes approximately constant time, regardless of the number of items in the bag.

member.param: The item to add to the bag.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.AddRepresentative(`0)
member.summary: Adds a new item to the bag. Since bags can contain duplicate items, the item is added even if the bag already contains an item equal to . In this case (unlike Add), the new item becomes the representative item.

remarks.para: Adding an item takes approximately constant time, regardless of the number of items in the bag.

member.param: The item to add to the bag.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.ChangeNumberOfCopies(`0,System.Int32)
member.summary: Changes the number of copies of an existing item in the bag, or adds the indicated number of copies of the item to the bag.

remarks.para: Changing the number of copies takes approximately constant time, regardless of the number of items in the bag.

member.param: The item to change the number of copies of. This may or may not already be present in the bag.
The new number of copies of the item.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.AddMany(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Adds all the items in to the bag.

remarks.para: Adding the collection takes time O(M log N), where N is the number of items in the bag, and M is the number of items in .

member.param: A collection of items to add to the bag.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Searches the bag for one item equal to , and if found, removes it from the bag. If not found, the bag is unchanged.

remarks.para: Equality between items is determined by the comparison instance or delegate used to create the bag.
Removing an item from the bag takes approximated constant time, regardless of the number of items in the bag.

member.returns: True if was found and removed. False if was not in the bag.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.RemoveAllCopies(`0)
member.summary: Searches the bag for all items equal to , and removes all of them from the bag. If not found, the bag is unchanged.

remarks.para: Equality between items is determined by the comparer instance used to create the bag.
RemoveAllCopies() takes time O(M log N), where N is the total number of items in the bag, and M is the number of items equal to .

member.returns: The number of copies of that were found and removed.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.RemoveMany(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Removes all the items in from the bag. Items that are not present in the bag are ignored.

remarks.para: Equality between items is determined by the comparer instance used to create the bag.
Removing the collection takes time O(M), where M is the number of items in .

member.param: A collection of items to remove from the bag.
member.returns: The number of items removed from the bag.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.Clear
member.summary: Removes all items from the bag.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.UnionWith(Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag{`0})
member.summary: Computes the union of this bag with another bag. The union of two bags is all items from both of the bags. If an item appears X times in one bag, and Y times in the other bag, the union contains the item Maximum(X,Y) times. This bag receives the union of the two bags, the other bag is unchanged.

remarks.para: The union of two bags is computed in time O(M+N), where M and N are the size of the two bags.

member.exception: This bag and don't use the same method for comparing items.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.Union(Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag{`0})
member.summary: Computes the union of this bag with another bag. The union of two bags is all items from both of the bags. If an item appears X times in one bag, and Y times in the other bag, the union contains the item Maximum(X,Y) times. A new bag is created with the union of the bags and is returned. This bag and the other bag are unchanged.

remarks.para: The union of two bags is computed in time O(M+N), where M and N are the size of the two bags.

member.returns: The union of the two bags.
member.exception: This bag and don't use the same method for comparing items.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.SumWith(Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag{`0})
member.summary: Computes the sum of this bag with another bag. The sum of two bags is all items from both of the bags. If an item appears X times in one bag, and Y times in the other bag, the sum contains the item (X+Y) times. This bag receives the sum of the two bags, the other bag is unchanged.

remarks.para: The sum of two bags is computed in time O(M), where M is the size of the other bag..

member.exception: This bag and don't use the same method for comparing items.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.Sum(Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag{`0})
member.summary: Computes the sum of this bag with another bag. he sum of two bags is all items from both of the bags. If an item appears X times in one bag, and Y times in the other bag, the sum contains the item (X+Y) times. A new bag is created with the sum of the bags and is returned. This bag and the other bag are unchanged.

remarks.para: The sum of two bags is computed in time O(M + N log M), where M is the size of the larger bag, and N is the size of the smaller bag.

member.returns: The sum of the two bags.
member.exception: This bag and don't use the same method for comparing items.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.IntersectionWith(Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag{`0})
member.summary: Computes the intersection of this bag with another bag. The intersection of two bags is all items that appear in both of the bags. If an item appears X times in one bag, and Y times in the other bag, the sum contains the item Minimum(X,Y) times. This bag receives the intersection of the two bags, the other bag is unchanged.

remarks.para: When equal items appear in both bags, the intersection will include an arbitrary choice of one of the two equal items.
The intersection of two bags is computed in time O(N), where N is the size of the smaller bag.

member.exception: This bag and don't use the same method for comparing items.

If an item appears X times in one bag, and Y times in the other bag, the intersection contains the item Minimum(X,Y) times. A new bag is created with the intersection of the bags and is returned. This bag and the other bag are unchanged.

remarks.para: When equal items appear in both bags, the intersection will include an arbitrary choice of one of the two equal items.
The intersection of two bags is computed in time O(N), where N is the size of the smaller bag.

member.returns: The intersection of the two bags.
member.exception: This bag and don't use the same method for comparing items.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.DifferenceWith(Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag{`0})
member.summary: Computes the difference of this bag with another bag. The difference of these two bags is all items that appear in this bag, but not in . If an item appears X times in this bag, and Y times in the other bag, the difference contains the item X - Y times (zero times if Y >= X). This bag receives the difference of the two bags; the other bag is unchanged.

remarks.para: The difference of two bags is computed in time O(M), where M is the size of the other bag.

member.exception: This bag and don't use the same method for comparing items.

member.summary: Computes the difference of this bag with another bag. The difference of these two bags is all items that appear in this bag, but not in . If an item appears X times in this bag, and Y times in the other bag, the difference contains the item X - Y times (zero times if Y >= X). A new bag is created with the difference of the bags and is returned. This bag and the other bag are unchanged.

remarks.para: The difference of two bags is computed in time O(M + N), where M and N are the size of the two bags.

member.returns: The difference of the two bags.
member.exception: This bag and don't use the same method for comparing items.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag`1.SymmetricDifferenceWith(Wintellect.PowerCollections.Bag{`0})
member.summary: Computes the symmetric difference of this bag with another bag. The symmetric difference of two bags is all items that appear in either of the bags, but not both. If an item appears X times in one bag, and Y times in the other bag, the symmetric difference contains the item AbsoluteValue(X - Y) times. This bag receives the symmetric difference of the two bags; the other bag is unchanged.

member.name: T:Wintellect.PowerCollections.CollectionBase`1
member.summary: CollectionBase is a base class that can be used to more easily implement the generic ICollection<T> and non-generic ICollection interfaces.

remarks.para: To use CollectionBase as a base class, the derived class must override the Count, GetEnumerator, Add, Clear, and Remove methods.
ICollection<T>.Contains need not be implemented by the derived class, but it should be strongly considered, because the CollectionBase implementation may not be very efficient.

member.typeparam: The item type of the collection.

member.name: T:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Hash`1
member.summary: The base implementation for various collections classes that use hash tables as part of their implementation. This class should not (and can not) be used directly by end users; it's only for internal use by the collections package. The Hash does not handle duplicate values.
member.remarks: The Hash manages items of type T, and uses a IComparer<ItemTYpe> that hashes compares items to hash items into the table.

member.name: T:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Hash`1.Slot
member.summary: The structure that has each slot in the hash table. Each slot has three parts: 1. The collision bit. Indicates whether some item visited this slot but had to keep looking because the slot was full. 2. 31-bit full hash value of the item. If zero, the slot is empty. 3. The item itself.

member.name: P:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Hash`1.Slot.HashValue
member.summary: The full hash value associated with the value in this slot, or zero if the slot is empty.

member.name: P:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Hash`1.Slot.Empty
member.summary: Is this slot empty?

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Hash`1.Slot.Clear
member.summary: Clear this slot, leaving the collision bit alone.

member.name: P:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Hash`1.Slot.Collision
member.summary: The "Collision" bit indicates that some value hit this slot and collided, so had to try another slot.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Hash`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{`0})
member.summary: Constructor. Create a new hash table.
member.param: The comparer to use to compare items.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Hash`1.GetEnumerationStamp
member.summary: Gets the current enumeration stamp. Call CheckEnumerationStamp later with this value to throw an exception if the hash table is changed.
member.returns: The current enumeration stamp.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Hash`1.StopEnumerations
member.summary: Must be called whenever there is a structural change in the tree. Causes changeStamp to be changed, which causes any in-progress enumerations to throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Hash`1.CheckEnumerationStamp(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks the given stamp against the current change stamp. If different, the collection has changed during enumeration and an InvalidOperationException must be thrown
member.param: changeStamp at the start of the enumeration.

member.summary: ListBase is an abstract class that can be used as a base class for a read-write collection that needs to implement the generic IList<T> and non-generic IList collections. The derived class needs to override the following methods: Count, Clear, Insert, RemoveAt, and the indexer. The implementation of all the other methods in IList<T> and IList are handled by ListBase.

member.summary: Returns a view onto a sub-range of this list. Items are not copied; the returned IList<T> is simply a different view onto the same underlying items. Changes to this list are reflected in the view, and vice versa. Insertions and deletions in the view change the size of the view, but insertions and deletions in the underlying list do not.
member.remarks: This method can be used to apply an algorithm to a portion of a list. For example: Algorithms.ReverseInPlace(deque.Range(3, 6)) will reverse the 6 items beginning at index 3.
member.param: The starting index of the view.

member.returns: A list that is a view onto the given sub-part of this list.

member.name: T:Wintellect.PowerCollections.MultiDictionaryBase`2
member.summary: MultiDictionaryBase is a base class that can be used to more easily implement a class that associates multiple values to a single key. The class implements the generic IDictionary<TKey, ICollection<TValue>> interface.

remarks.para: To use MultiDictionaryBase as a base class, the derived class must override Count, Clear, Add, Remove(TKey), Remove(TKey,TValue), Contains(TKey,TValue), EnumerateKeys, and TryEnumerateValuesForKey.
It may wish consider overriding CountValues, CountAllValues, ContainsKey, and EqualValues, but these are not required.

member.typeparam: The key type of the dictionary.
The value type of the dictionary.

member.name: T:Wintellect.PowerCollections.OrderedMultiDictionary`2

summary.para: The OrderedMultiDictionary class that associates values with a key. Unlike an OrderedDictionary, each key can have multiple values associated with it. When indexing an OrderedMultidictionary, instead of a single value associated with a key, you retrieve an enumeration of values.
All of the key are stored in sorted order. Also, the values associated with a given key are kept in sorted order as well.
When constructed, you can chose to allow the same value to be associated with a key multiple times, or only one time.

member.typeparam: The type of the keys.
The of values associated with the keys.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.OrderedMultiDictionary`2.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a new OrderedMultiDictionary. The default ordering of keys and values are used. If duplicate values are allowed, multiple copies of the same value can be associated with the same key. For example, the key "foo" could have "a", "a", and "b" associated with it. If duplicate values are not allowed, only one copies of a given value can be associated with the same key, although different keys can have the same value. For example, the key "foo" could have "a" and "b" associated with it, which key "bar" has values "b" and "c" associated with it.
member.remarks: The default ordering of keys and values will be used, as defined by TKey and TValue's implementation of IComparable<T> (or IComparable if IComparable<T> is not implemented). If a different ordering should be used, other constructors allow a custom Comparer or IComparer to be passed to changed the ordering.
member.param: Can the same value be associated with a key multiple times?
member.exception: TKey or TValue does not implement either IComparable<T> or IComparable.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.OrderedMultiDictionary`2.CloneContents
member.summary: Makes a deep clone of this dictionary. A new dictionary is created with a clone of each entry of this dictionary, by calling ICloneable.Clone on each element. If TKey or TValue is a value type, then each element is copied as if by simple assignment.

remarks.para: If TKey or TValue is a reference type, it must implement ICloneable. Otherwise, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.
Cloning the dictionary takes time O(N log N), where N is the number of key-value pairs in the dictionary.

member.returns: The cloned dictionary.
member.exception: TKey or TValue is a reference type that does not implement ICloneable.

member.summary: Returns a View collection that can be used for enumerating the keys and values in the collection in reversed order.

remarks.p: If an entry is added to or deleted from the dictionary while the View is being enumerated, then the enumeration will end with an InvalidOperationException.

The keys are enumerated in sorted order. Keys equal to the end points of the range can be included or excluded depending on the and parameters.

remarks.p: If is greater than or equal to , the returned collection is empty.
The sorted order of the keys is determined by the comparison instance or delegate used to create the dictionary.
Typically, this property is used in conjunction with a foreach statement. For example:
Calling Range does not copy the data in the dictionary, and the operation takes constant time.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Pair`2.CompareTo(Wintellect.PowerCollections.Pair{`0,`1})

summary.para: Compares this pair to another pair of the some type. The pairs are compared by using the IComparable<T> or IComparable interface on TFirst and TSecond. The pairs are compared by their first elements first, if their first elements are equal, then they are compared by their second elements.
If either TFirst or TSecond does not implement IComparable<T> or IComparable, then an NotSupportedException is thrown, because the pairs cannot be compared.

member.returns: An integer indicating how this pair compares to . Less than zero indicates this pair is less than . Zero indicate this pair is equals to . Greater than zero indicates this pair is greater than .
member.exception: Either FirstSecond or TSecond is not comparable via the IComparable<T> or IComparable interfaces.

member.name: T:Wintellect.PowerCollections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase`1
member.summary: ReadOnlyCollectionBase is a base class that can be used to more easily implement the generic ICollection<T> and non-generic ICollection interfaces for a read-only collection: a collection that does not allow adding or removing elements.

remarks.para: To use ReadOnlyCollectionBase as a base class, the derived class must override the Count and GetEnumerator methods.
ICollection<T>.Contains need not be implemented by the derived class, but it should be strongly considered, because the ReadOnlyCollectionBase implementation may not be very efficient.

member.typeparam: The item type of the collection.

member.name: T:Wintellect.PowerCollections.RedBlackTree`1
member.summary: The base implementation for various collections classes that use Red-Black trees as part of their implementation. This class should not (and can not) be used directly by end users; it's only for internal use by the collections package.
member.remarks: The Red-Black tree manages items of type T, and uses a IComparer<T> that compares items to sort the tree. Multiple items can compare equal and be stored in the tree. Insert, Delete, and Find operations are provided in their full generality; all operations allow dealing with either the first or last of items that compare equal.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.RedBlackTree`1.GetNodeStack
member.summary: Create an array of Nodes big enough for any path from top to bottom. This is cached, and reused from call-to-call, so only one can be around at a time per tree.
member.returns: The node stack.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.RedBlackTree`1.Delete(`0,System.Boolean,`0@)
member.summary: Deletes a key from the tree. If multiple elements are equal to key, deletes the first or last. If no element is equal to the key, returns false.
member.remarks: Top-down algorithm from Weiss. Basic plan is to move down in the tree, rotating and recoloring along the way to always keep the current node red, which ensures that the node we delete is red. The details are quite complex, however!
member.param: Which item to delete if multiple are equal to key. True to delete the first, false to delete last.
Returns the item that was deleted, if true returned.
member.returns: True if an element was deleted, false if no element had specified key.

member.name: T:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1
member.summary: Set<T> is a collection that contains items of type T. The item are maintained in a haphazard, unpredictable order, and duplicate items are not allowed.

remarks.p: The items are compared in one of two ways. If T implements IComparable<T> then the Equals method of that interface will be used to compare items, otherwise the Equals method from Object will be used. Alternatively, an instance of IComparer<T> can be passed to the constructor to use to compare items.
Set is implemented as a hash table. Inserting, deleting, and looking up an an element all are done in approximately constant time, regardless of the number of items in the Set.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new Set. The Equals method and GetHashCode method on T will be used to compare items for equality.
member.remarks: Items that are null are permitted, and will be sorted before all other items.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{`0})
member.summary: Creates a new Set. The Equals and GetHashCode method of the passed comparer object will be used to compare items in this set.
member.param: An instance of IEqualityComparer<T> that will be used to compare items.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Creates a new Set. The Equals method and GetHashCode method on T will be used to compare items for equality.
member.remarks: Items that are null are permitted.
member.param: A collection with items to be placed into the Set.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{`0})
member.summary: Creates a new Set. The Equals and GetHashCode method of the passed comparer object will be used to compare items in this set. The set is initialized with all the items in the given collection.
member.param: A collection with items to be placed into the Set.
An instance of IEqualityComparer<T> that will be used to compare items.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEqualityComparer{`0},Wintellect.PowerCollections.Hash{`0})
member.summary: Creates a new Set given a comparer and a tree that contains the data. Used internally for Clone.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1.System#ICloneable#Clone
member.summary: Makes a shallow clone of this set; i.e., if items of the set are reference types, then they are not cloned. If T is a value type, then each element is copied as if by simple assignment.
member.remarks: Cloning the set takes time O(N), where N is the number of items in the set.
member.returns: The cloned set.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1.Clone
member.summary: Makes a shallow clone of this set; i.e., if items of the set are reference types, then they are not cloned. If T is a value type, then each element is copied as if by simple assignment.
member.remarks: Cloning the set takes time O(N), where N is the number of items in the set.
member.returns: The cloned set.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1.CloneContents
member.summary: Makes a deep clone of this set. A new set is created with a clone of each element of this set, by calling ICloneable.Clone on each element. If T is a value type, then each element is copied as if by simple assignment.

remarks.para: If T is a reference type, it must implement ICloneable. Otherwise, an InvalidOperationException is thrown.
Cloning the set takes time O(N), where N is the number of items in the set.

member.returns: The cloned set.
member.exception: T is a reference type that does not implement ICloneable.

member.name: P:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1.Comparer
member.summary: Returns the IEqualityComparer<T> used to compare items in this set.
member.value: If the set was created using a comparer, that comparer is returned. Otherwise the default comparer for T (EqualityComparer<T>.Default) is returned.

member.name: P:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of items in the set.
member.remarks: The size of the set is returned in constant time.
member.value: The number of items in the set.

member.name: M:Wintellect.PowerCollections.Set`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an enumerator that enumerates all the items in the set. The items are enumerated in sorted order.

remarks.p: Typically, this method is not called directly. Instead the "foreach" statement is used to enumerate the items, which uses this method implicitly.
If an item is added to or deleted from the set while it is being enumerated, then the enumeration will end with an InvalidOperationException.
Enumerating all the items in the set takes time O(N), where N is the number of items in the set.

member.returns: An enumerator for enumerating all the items in the Set.

member.returns: True if the set contains . False if the set does not contain .

The union of two sets is computed in time O(M + N), where M is the size of the larger set, and N is the size of the smaller set.

member.name: T:MathNet.Numerics.Complex
member.summary: Complex numbers class.

remarks.p: The class Complex provides all elementary operations on complex numbers. All the operators +, -, *, /, ==, != are defined in the canonical way. Additional complex trigonometric functions such as , , ... are also provided. Note that the Complex structures has two special constant values and .
In order to avoid possible ambiguities resulting from a Complex(double, double) constructor, the static methods and are provided instead.
Since there is no canonical order amoung the complex numbers, Complex does not implement IComparable but several lexicographic IComparer implementations are provided, see , and .
For mathematical details about complex numbers, please have a look at the Wikipedia

If you need more formal complex number handling (according to the Riemann Sphere and the extended complex plane C*, or using directed infinity) please check out the alternative MathNet.PreciseNumerics and MathNet.Symbolics packages instead.

member.summary: Converts the given double to a string representation of its exact decimal value.
member.return: A string representation of the double's exact decimal value.

remarks.p: The .Net framework often round-up the double value when converting them into string. This behavior however might be troublesome for application. The method ToExactString provides, as the name suggests, an non-rounded string conversion of a double value.

member.name: T:MathNet.Numerics.LinearAlgebra.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
This namespace is a port of the JAMA library.
The MathNet.Numerics.LinearAlgebra provides the fundamental operations of numerical linear algebra. Various constructors create Matrices from two dimensional arrays of double precision floating point numbers. Various "gets" and "sets" provide access to submatrices and matrix elements. Several methods implement basic matrix arithmetic, including matrix addition and multiplication, matrix norms, and element-by-element array operations. Methods for reading and printing matrices are also included. All the operations in this version of the Matrix Class involve real matrices. Complex matrices may be handled in a future version.
Five fundamental matrix decompositions, which consist of pairs or triples of matrices, permutation vectors, and the like, produce results in five decomposition classes. These decompositions are accessed by the Matrix class to compute solutions of simultaneous linear equations, determinants, inverses and other matrix functions.
The five decompositions are:
Cholesky Decomposition of symmetric, positive definite matrices.
LU Decomposition of rectangular matrices.
QR Decomposition of rectangular matrices.
Singular Value Decomposition of rectangular matrices.
Eigenvalue Decomposition of both symmetric and nonsymmetric square matrices.
Example of use: Solve a linear system A x = b and compute the residual norm, ||b - A x||.
double[,] vals = {{1.,2.,3.},{4.,5.,6.},{7.,8.,10.}}; Matrix a = new Matrix(vals); Matrix b = Matrix.Random(3,1); Matrix x = a.Solve(b); Matrix r = a * x - b; double rnorm = r.NormInf();
Author: The MathWorks, Inc. and the National Institute of Standards and Technology (5 August 1998).
Port: Joannes Vermorel (2004).

member.remarks: Table object names are case insensitive.

member.name: P:netDxf.Blocks.Block.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the block description.
member.remarks:
AutoCAD has an unknown limit on the number of characters for the description when loading an external DXF, while, on the other hand is perfectly capable of saving a Block description that surpasses such limit.
Keep in mind that when saving a DXF prior to the AutoCad2007 version, non-ASCII characters will be encoded, therefore a single letter might consume more characters when saved into the DXF.
New line characters are not allowed.

member.name: P:netDxf.Blocks.Block.Origin

member.name: P:netDxf.Blocks.Block.Layer

member.remarks: It seems that the block layer is always the default "0" regardless of what is defined here, so it is pointless to change this value.

member.name: T:netDxf.Collections.Groups
member.summary: Represents a collection of groups.

member.name: M:netDxf.Collections.Groups.Add(netDxf.Objects.Group,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a group to the list.
member.param: Group to add to the list.
Specifies if a handle needs to be generated for the group parameter.
member.returns:
If a group already exists with the same name as the instance that is being added the method returns the existing group, if not it will return the new group.
The methods will automatically add the grouped entities to the document, if they have not been added previously.

member.param: Group name to remove from the document.
member.returns: True if the group has been successfully removed, or false otherwise.
member.remarks: Removing a group only deletes it from the collection, the entities that once belonged to the group are not deleted.

member.name: T:netDxf.Collections.Layouts
member.summary: Represents a collection of layouts.
member.remarks: AutoCad limits the number of layouts to 256, but at the same time it allows to import DXF files with more than that, for this reason the max capacity has been set to short.MaxValue. The maximum number of layouts is also limited by the number of blocks, due to that for each layout a block record must exist in the blocks collection.

member.name: M:netDxf.Collections.Layouts.GetReferences(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the dxf objects referenced by a T.
member.returns: The list of DxfObjects that reference the specified table object.
member.remarks:
If there is no table object with the specified name in the list the method an empty list.
The Groups collection method GetReferences will always return an empty list since there are no DxfObjects that references them.

member.name: M:netDxf.Collections.Layouts.GetReferences(netDxf.Objects.Layout)
member.summary: Gets the dxf objects referenced by a T.
member.returns: The list of DxfObjects that reference the specified table object.

The Groups collection method GetReferences will always return an empty list since there are no DxfObjects that references them.

member.name: M:netDxf.Collections.Layouts.Add(netDxf.Objects.Layout,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a layout to the list.
member.param: Layout to add to the list.
Specifies if a handle needs to be generated for the layout parameter.
member.returns: If a layout already exists with the same name as the instance that is being added the method returns the existing layout.

member.name: M:netDxf.Collections.Layouts.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a layout and removes the layout entities from the document.
member.param: Layout name to remove from the document.
member.returns: True if the layout has been successfully removed, or false otherwise.
member.remarks:
The ModelSpace layout cannot be removed. If all PaperSpace layouts have been removed a default PaperSpace will be created since it is required by the DXF implementation.
When a Layout is deleted all entities that has been added to it will also be removed.
Removing a Layout will rebuild the PaperSpace block names, to follow the naming rule: Paper_Space, Paper_Space0, Paper_Space1, ...

member.name: M:netDxf.Collections.Layouts.Remove(netDxf.Objects.Layout)
member.summary: Deletes a layout and removes the layout entities from the document.
member.param: Layout to remove from the document.
member.returns: True if the layout has been successfully removed, or false otherwise.
member.remarks: Reserved layouts or any other referenced by objects cannot be removed.

member.summary: Adds all linetypes to the list from the definition in a LIN file.

member.remarks:
If the file is not found in the specified folder, it will try to find them in the list of supported folders defined in the DxfDocument.
Any text style or shape present in the linetype definition must be previously defined in the DxfDocument, if not an exception will be generated.

member.returns: True if the linetype has been added from the linetype definitions LIN file; false otherwise. It will return false if the linetype is present in the file and the reload argument is false.
member.remarks:
If the file is not found in the specified folder, it will try to find them in the list of supported folders defined in the DxfDocument.
Any text style or shape present in the linetype definition must be previously defined in the DxfDocument, if not an exception will be generated.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of handles generated, this value is saved as an hexadecimal in the drawing variables HandleSeed property.

member.name: P:netDxf.DxfDocument.SupportFolders
member.summary: Gets the list of folders where the drawing support files are present.
member.remarks: When shape linetype segments are used, the shape number will be obtained reading the .shp file equivalent to the .shx file, that file will be looked for in the same folder as the .shx file or one of the document support folders.

member.name: P:netDxf.DxfDocument.BuildDimensionBlocks
member.remarks:
By default this value is set to false, no dimension blocks will be generated when adding dimension entities to the document. It will be the responsibility of the program importing the DXF to generate the drawing that represent the dimensions.
When set to true the block that represents the dimension will be generated, keep in mind that this process is limited and not all options available in the dimension style will be reflected in the final result.
When importing a file if the dimension block is present it will be read, regardless of this value. If, later, the dimension is modified all updates will be done with the limited dimension drawing capabilities of the library, in this case, if you want that the new modifications to be reflected when the file is saved again you can set the dimension block to null, and the program reading the resulting file will regenerate the block with the new modifications.

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.AddEntity(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{netDxf.Entities.EntityObject})
member.summary: Adds a list of entities to the document.
member.param: A list of entities to add to the document.

member.summary: Adds an entity to the document.
member.param: An entity to add to the document.

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.RemoveEntity(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{netDxf.Entities.EntityObject})
member.summary: Removes a list of entities from the document.
member.param: A list of entities to remove from the document.
member.remarks:
This function will not remove other tables objects that might be not in use as result from the elimination of the entity.
This includes empty layers, blocks not referenced anymore, line types, text styles, dimension styles, and application registries.
Entities that are part of a block definition will not be removed.

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.RemoveEntity(netDxf.Entities.EntityObject)
member.summary: Removes an entity from the document.
member.param: The entity to remove from the document.
member.returns: True if item is successfully removed; otherwise, false. This method also returns false if item was not found.
member.remarks:
This function will not remove other tables objects that might be not in use as result from the elimination of the entity.
This includes empty layers, blocks not referenced anymore, line types, text styles, dimension styles, multiline styles, groups, and application registries.
Entities that are part of a block definition will not be removed.

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.Load(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a DXF file.
member.returns: Returns a DxfDocument. It will return null if the file has not been able to load.
member.remarks:
Loading DXF files prior to AutoCad 2000 is not supported.
The Load method will still raise an exception if they are unable to create the FileStream.
On Debug mode it will raise any exception that might occur during the whole process.

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.Load(System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Loads a DXF file.
member.param: List of the document support folders.
member.returns: Returns a DxfDocument. It will return null if the file has not been able to load.
member.remarks:
Loading DXF files prior to AutoCad 2000 is not supported.
The Load method will still raise an exception if they are unable to create the FileStream.
On Debug mode it will raise any exception that might occur during the whole process.

member.name: M:netDxf.DxfDocument.Load(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Loads a DXF file.
member.returns: Returns a DxfDocument. It will return null if the file has not been able to load.
member.remarks:
Loading DXF files prior to AutoCad 2000 is not supported.
On Debug mode it will raise any exception that might occur during the whole process.
The caller will be responsible of closing the stream.

member.remarks: Some objects might consume more than one, is, for example, the case of polylines that will assign automatically a handle to its vertexes. The entity number will be converted to an hexadecimal number.

member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the center point and the dimension line.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Angular2LineDimension.Measurement
member.summary: Actual measurement.
member.remarks: The dimension is always measured in the plane defined by the normal.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Angular2LineDimension.SetDimensionLinePosition(netDxf.Vector2)
member.summary: Calculates the dimension offset from a point along the dimension line.
member.remarks: The start and end points of the reference lines will be modified, the angle measurement is always made from the direction of the first line to the direction of the second line.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Angular2LineDimension.TransformBy(netDxf.Matrix3,netDxf.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves, scales, and/or rotates the current entity given a 3x3 transformation matrix and a translation vector.
member.remarks:
Non-uniform and zero scaling local to the dimension entity are not supported.
The transformation will not be applied if the resulting reference lines are parallel.
Matrix3 adopts the convention of using column vectors to represent a transformation matrix.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.Attribute
member.summary: Represents a attribute entity.
member.remarks:
The attribute position, rotation, height and width factor values also includes the transformation of the Insert entity to which it belongs.
During the attribute initialization a copy of all attribute definition properties will be copied, so any changes made to the attribute definition will only be applied to new attribute instances and not to existing ones. This behavior is to allow imported Insert entities to have attributes without definition in the block, although this might sound not totally correct it is allowed by AutoCad.

member.summary: Moves, scales, and/or rotates the current entity given a 3x3 transformation matrix and a translation vector.
member.remarks:
Non-uniform and zero scaling local to the dimension entity are not supported.
The transformation will not be applied if the resulting center and reference points are the same.
Matrix3 adopts the convention of using column vectors to represent a transformation matrix.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.Dimension
member.summary: Represents the base class for a dimension entity.
member.reamarks: Once a dimension is added to the DXF document, its properties should not be modified or the changes will not be reflected in the saved DXF file.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.#ctor(netDxf.Entities.DimensionType)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Dimension class.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.DefinitionPoint
member.summary: Gets the reference position for the dimension line in local coordinates.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.TextPositionManuallySet
member.summary: Gets or sets if the text reference point has been set by the user. Set to false to reset the dimension text to its original position.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.TextReferencePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the text reference position, the middle point of dimension text in local coordinates.
member.remarks: This value is related to the style property FitTextMove. If the style FitTextMove is set to BesidesDimLine the text reference point will take precedence over the offset value to place the dimension line. In case of Ordinate dimensions if the text has been manually set the text position will take precedence over the EndLeaderPoint only if FitTextMove has been set to OverDimLineWithoutLeader.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the style associated with the dimension.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.StyleOverrides
member.summary: Gets the dimension style overrides list.
member.remarks: Any dimension style value stored in this list will override its corresponding value in the assigned style to the dimension.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.DimensionType
member.summary: Gets the dimension type.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.Measurement
member.summary: Gets the actual measurement.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.AttachmentPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension text attachment point.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.LineSpacingStyle
member.summary: Get or sets the dimension text line spacing style.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.LineSpacingFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension text line spacing factor.
member.remarks: Percentage of default line spacing to be applied. Valid values range from 0.25 to 4.00, the default value 1.0.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.Block
member.summary: Gets the block that contains the entities that make up the dimension picture.
member.remarks:
Set this value to null to force the program that reads the resulting DXF file to generate the dimension drawing block, some programs do not even care about this block and will always generate their own dimension drawings.
You can even use your own dimension drawing setting this value with the resulting block. The assigned block name is irrelevant, it will be automatically modified to accommodate the naming conventions of the blocks for dimension (*D#).
The block will be overwritten when adding the dimension to a DxfDocument if BuildDimensionBlocks is set to true.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.TextRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation angle in degrees of the dimension text away from its default orientation(the direction of the dimension line).

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.UserText
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension text explicitly.
member.remarks: Dimension text explicitly entered by the user. Optional; default is the measurement. If null or "<>", the dimension measurement is drawn as the text, if " " (one blank space), the text is suppressed. Anything else is drawn as the text.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.Elevation
member.summary: Gets or sets the dimension elevation, its position along its normal.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.CalculateReferencePoints
member.summary: Calculate the dimension reference points.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.BuildBlock(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the block that contains the entities that make up the dimension picture.
member.param: Name to be assigned to the generated block.
member.returns: The block that represents the actual dimension.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Dimension.Update
member.summary: Updates the internal data of the dimension and if needed it rebuilds the block definition of the actual dimension.
member.remarks: This method needs to be manually called to reflect any change made to the dimension properties (geometry and/or style).

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.DimensionArrowhead
member.summary: Predefined shapes for dimension style arrowheads.
member.remarks:
Arrowhead block names and its representation.
"" = closed filled
"_DOT" = dot
"_DOTSMALL" = dot small
"_DOTBLANK" = dot blank
"_ORIGIN" = origin indicator
"_ORIGIN2" = origin indicator 2
"_OPEN" = open
"_OPEN90" = open 90 (right angle)
"_OPEN30" = open 30
"_CLOSED" = closed
"_SMALL" = dot small blank
"_NONE" = none
"_OBLIQUE" = oblique
"_BOXFILLED" = box filled
"_BOXBLANK" = box
"_CLOSEDBLANK" = closed blank
"_DATUMFILLED" = datum triangle filled
"_DATUMBLANK" = datum triangle
"_INTEGRAL" = integral
"_ARCHTICK" = architectural tick

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.DimensionBlock
member.summary: Holds methods to build the dimension blocks.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.DimensionBlock.Build(netDxf.Entities.Dimension)
member.summary: Creates a block that represents the drawing of the specified dimension.
member.param: Dimension from which the block will be created.
member.returns: A block that represents the specified dimension.
member.remarks:
By the fault the block will have the name "DimBlock". The block's name is irrelevant when the dimension belongs to a document, it will be automatically renamed to accommodate to the nomenclature of the DXF.
The dimension block creation only supports a limited number of dimension style properties. Also the list of dimension style overrides associated with the specified dimension will be applied where necessary.

The dimension block creation only supports a limited number of dimension style properties. Also the list of dimension style overrides associated with the specified dimension will be applied where necessary.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.DimensionBlock.Build(netDxf.Entities.OrdinateDimension,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a block that represents the drawing of the specified dimension.
member.param: OrdinateDimension from which the block will be created.
member.returns: A block that represents the specified dimension.
member.remarks:
The block's name is irrelevant when the dimension belongs to a document, it will be automatically renamed to accommodate to the nomenclature of the DXF.
The dimension block creation only supports a limited number of dimension style properties. Also the list of dimension style overrides associated with the specified dimension will be applied where necessary.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.Hatch
member.summary: Represents a hatch entity.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.#ctor(netDxf.Entities.HatchPattern,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Hatch class.
member.remarks:
This constructor is initialized with an empty list of boundary paths, remember a hatch without boundaries will be discarded when saving the file.
When creating an associative hatch do not add the entities that make the boundary to the document, it will be done automatically. Doing so will throw an exception.
The hatch boundary paths must be on the same plane as the hatch. The normal and the elevation of the boundary paths will be omitted (the hatch elevation and normal will be used instead). Only the x and y coordinates for the center of the line, ellipse, circle and arc will be used.
member.param: Defines if the hatch is associative or not.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.#ctor(netDxf.Entities.HatchPattern,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{netDxf.Entities.HatchBoundaryPath},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Hatch class.
member.remarks: The hatch boundary paths must be on the same plane as the hatch. The normal and the elevation of the boundary paths will be omitted (the hatch elevation and normal will be used instead). Only the x and y coordinates for the center of the line, ellipse, circle and arc will be used.
member.param: Defines if the hatch is associative or not.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.Pattern
member.summary: Gets the hatch pattern.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.BoundaryPaths
member.summary: Gets the hatch boundary paths.
member.remarks: The hatch must contain at least on valid boundary path to be able to add it to the DxfDocument, otherwise it will be rejected.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.Associative
member.summary: Gets if the hatch is associative or not, which means if the hatch object is associated with the hatch boundary entities.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.Elevation
member.summary: Gets or sets the hatch elevation, its position along its normal.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.UnLinkBoundary
member.summary: Unlinks the boundary from the hatch, turning the associative property to false.
member.returns: The list of unlinked entities from the boundary of the hatch.
member.remarks: The entities that make the hatch boundaries will not be deleted from the document if they already belong to one.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.CreateBoundary(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a list of entities that represents the boundary of the hatch and optionally associates to it.
member.param: Indicates if the new boundary will be associated with the hatch, turning the associative property to true.
member.returns: A list of entities that makes the boundary of the hatch.
member.remarks:
If the actual hatch is already associative, the old boundary entities will be unlinked, but not deleted from the hatch document. If linkBoundary is true, the new boundary entities will be added to the same layout and document as the hatch, in case it belongs to one, so, in this case, if you also try to add the return list to the document it will cause an error.
All entities are in world coordinates except the LwPolyline boundary path since by definition its vertexes are expressed in object coordinates.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.TransformBy(netDxf.Matrix3,netDxf.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves, scales, and/or rotates the current entity given a 3x3 transformation matrix and a translation vector.
member.remarks: Matrix3 adopts the convention of using column vectors to represent a transformation matrix.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Hatch.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new Hatch that is a copy of the current instance.
member.returns: A new Hatch that is a copy of this instance.
member.remarks: If the hatch is associative the referenced boundary entities will not be automatically cloned, its associative property will be set to false. Use CreateBoundary if required after cloning.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.HatchBoundaryPath
member.summary: Represent a loop of a hatch boundaries.
member.remarks:
The entities that make a loop can be any combination of lines, light weight polylines, polylines, circles, arcs, ellipses, and splines.
The entities that define a loop should define a closed path, they have to be on the same plane as the hatch, and with the same normal; if these conditions are not met the result might be unpredictable.
Entities expressed in 3d coordinates like lines, polylines, and splines will be projected into its local plane. All edges that make a HatchBoundaryPath are 2d objects, only have X and Y coordinates. This is why to avoid unexpected results is important that all entities that define the paths have the same normal, same reference plane.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Insert.Sync
member.summary: Updates the actual insert with the attribute properties currently defined in the block. This does not affect any values assigned to attributes in each block.
member.remarks: This method will automatically call the TransformAttributes method, to keep all attributes position and orientation up to date.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Insert.GetTransformation
member.summary: Calculates the insertion rotation matrix.
member.returns: The insert transformation matrix.
member.remarks: This method uses the DefaultInsUnits defined by the Insert class to obtain the scale between the drawing and the block units. Additionally, if the insert belongs to a block the units to use are the ones defined in the BlockRecord, and if the insert belongs to a layout the units to use are the ones defined in the document drawing variable InsUnits.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Insert.GetTransformation(netDxf.Units.DrawingUnits)
member.summary: Calculates the insertion rotation matrix.
member.returns: The insert transformation matrix.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Insert.TransformAttributes
member.summary: Recalculate the attributes position, normal, rotation, text height, width factor, and oblique angle from the values applied to the insertion.
member.remarks:
Changes to the insert, the block, or the document insertion units will require this method to be called manually.
The attributes position, normal, rotation, text height, width factor, and oblique angle values includes the transformations applied to the insertion, if required this method will calculate the proper values according to the ones defined by the attribute definition.
All the attribute values can be changed manually independently to its definition, but, usually, you will want them to be transformed with the insert based on the local values defined by the attribute definition.
This method only applies to attributes that have a definition, some DXF files might generate attributes that have no definition in the block.
At the moment the attribute width factor and oblique angle are not calculated, this is applied to inserts with non uniform scaling.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Insert.Explode
member.summary: Explodes the current insert.
member.returns: A list of entities.

member.summary: Moves, scales, and/or rotates the current entity given a 3x3 transformation matrix and a translation vector.
member.remarks: Matrix3 adopts the convention of using column vectors to represent a transformation matrix.

member.returns: Next available entity number.
member.remarks: Some objects might consume more than one, is, for example, the case of polylines that will assign automatically a handle to its vertexes. The entity number will be converted to an hexadecimal number.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Leader.Annotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the leader annotation entity.
member.remarks:
Only MText, Text, Tolerance, and Insert entities are supported as a leader annotation. Even if AutoCad allows a Text entity to be part of a Leader it is not recommended, always use a MText entity instead.
Set the annotation property to null to create a Leader without annotation.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Leader.Hook
member.summary: Gets or sets the leader hook position (last leader vertex).
member.remarks: This property allows easy access to the last leader vertex, aka leader hook position. Remember the leader vertexes list must have at least two points.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Leader.HasHookline
member.summary: Gets if the leader has a hook line.
member.remarks: If set to true an additional vertex point (StartHookLine) will be created before the leader end point (hook). By default, only leaders with text annotation have hook lines.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Leader.LineColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the leader line color if the style parameter DIMCLRD is set as BYBLOCK.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Leader.Normal
member.summary: Gets or sets the entity normal.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Leader.Elevation
member.summary: Gets or sets the leader elevation.
member.remarks: This is the distance from the origin to the plane of the leader.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Leader.Offset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset from the last leader vertex (hook) to the annotation position.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Leader.Update(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Updates the leader entity to reflect the latest changes made to its properties.
member.param: If true the annotation position will be modified according to the position of the leader hook (last leader vertex), otherwise the leader hook will be moved according to the actual annotation position.
member.remarks: This method should be manually called if the annotation position is modified, or the leader properties like Style, Annotation, TextVerticalPosition, and/or Offset.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.Leader.ResetHookPosition
member.summary: Resets the leader hook position according to the annotation position.

member.summary: Obtains a list of vertexes that represent the polyline approximating the curve segments as necessary.
member.param: Curve segments precision (a value of zero means that no approximation will be made).
Tolerance to consider if two new generated vertexes are equal.

member.returns: A list of vertexes expressed in object coordinate system.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.LwPolyline.TransformBy(netDxf.Matrix3,netDxf.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves, scales, and/or rotates the current entity given a 3x3 transformation matrix and a translation vector.
member.remarks:
Non-uniform scaling is not supported if a bulge different than zero is applied to any of the LwPolyline vertexes, a non-uniform scaling cannot be applied to the arc segments. Explode the entity and convert the arcs into ellipse arcs and transform them instead.
Matrix3 adopts the convention of using column vectors to represent a transformation matrix.

member.summary: Gets or set the light weight polyline bulge.
member.remarks: The bulge is the tangent of one fourth the included angle for an arc segment, made negative if the arc goes clockwise from the start point to the endpoint. A bulge of 0 indicates a straight segment, and a bulge of 1 is a semicircle.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.Mesh
member.summary: Represents a mesh entity.
member.remarks:
Use this entity to overcome the limitations of the PolyfaceMesh, but, keep in mind that this entity was first introduced in AutoCad 2010.
The maximum number of faces a mesh can have is 16000000 (16 millions).

member.summary: Get or set the highest smoothing level at which the crease is retained. If the smoothing level exceeds this value, the crease is also smoothed.
member.remarks:

Enter a value of -1 (any negative number will be reset to -1) to specify that the crease is always retained, even if the object or sub-object is smoothed or refined.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MLine.Update
member.summary: Calculates the internal information of the multiline vertexes.

remarks.para: This function needs to be called manually when any modification is done that affects the final shape of the multiline.

If the vertex distance list needs to be edited to represent trimmed multilines this function needs to be called prior to any modification. It will calculate the minimum information needed to build a correct multiline.

member.summary: Decompose the actual multiline in its internal entities, lines and arcs.

member.summary: Moves, scales, and/or rotates the current entity given a 3x3 transformation matrix and a translation vector.
member.remarks:
Non-uniform scaling is not supported for multilines. Explode the entity and, in case round end caps has been applied, convert the arcs into ellipse arcs and transform them instead.
Matrix3 adopts the convention of using column vectors to represent a transformation matrix.

member.summary: Gets the MLine vertex position.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MLineVertex.Direction
member.summary: Gets the MLine vertex direction.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MLineVertex.Miter
member.summary: Gets the MLine vertex miter.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MLineVertex.Distances
member.summary: Gets the multiline vertex distances lists.

remarks.para: There is a list for every MLineStyle element, and every list contains an array of real values that parametrize the start and end point of every element of the style.

The first value (index 0) represents the distance from the segment vertex along the miter vector to the point where the line element's path intersects the miter vector.
The second value (index 1) is the distance along the line element's direction from the point, defined by the first value, to the actual start of the line element.
The successive values list the start and stop points of the line element breaks or cuts in this segment of the multiline.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.MText
member.summary: Represents a multiline text entity.
member.remarks:
Formatting codes for MText, you can use them directly while setting the text value or use the Write() and EndParagraph() methods.
\L Start underline
\l Stop underline
\O Start overstrike
\o Stop overstrike
\K Start strike-through
\k Stop strike-through
\P New paragraph (new line)
\pxi Control codes for bullets, numbered paragraphs and columns
\X Paragraph wrap on the dimension line (only in dimensions)
\Q Slanting (obliquing) text by angle - e.g. \Q30;
\H Text height - e.g. \H3x;
\W Text width - e.g. \W0.8x;
\F Font selection
e.g. \Fgdt;o - GDT-tolerance
e.g. \Fkroeger|b0|i0|c238|p10; - font Kroeger, non-bold, non-italic, code page 238, pitch 10
\S Stacking, fractions
e.g. \SA^B;
A
B
e.g. \SX/Y
X
-
Y
e.g. \S1#4;
1/4
\A Alignment
\A0; = bottom
\A1; = center
\A2; = top
\C Color change
\C1; = red
\C2; = yellow
\C3; = green
\C4; = cyan
\C5; = blue
\C6; = magenta
\C7; = white
\T Tracking, char.spacing - e.g. \T2;
\~ Non-wrapping space, hard space
{} Braces - define the text area influenced by the code
\ Escape character - e.g. \\ = "\", \{ = "{"
Codes and braces can be nested up to 8 levels deep.

member.remarks: Percentage of default line spacing to be applied. Valid values range from 0.25 to 4.0, the default value 1.0.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MText.DrawingDirection
member.summary: Get or sets the text drawing direction.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MText.RectangleWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the text reference rectangle width.
member.remarks:
This value defines the width of the box where the text will fit.
If a paragraph width is longer than the rectangle width it will be broken in several lines, using the word spaces as breaking points.
If you specify a width of 0, word wrap is turned off and the width of the multiline text object is as wide as the longest line of text.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MText.WriteFraction(System.String,System.String,netDxf.Units.FractionFormatType)
member.summary: Formats a text string to represent a fraction.
member.returns: A text string that represents the fraction.
member.remarks: In fractions the characters '/' and '#' are reserved if you need to write them you must write "\/" and "\#", respectively.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MText.WriteFraction(System.String,System.String,netDxf.Units.FractionFormatType,netDxf.Entities.MTextFormattingOptions)
member.summary: Formats a text string to represent a fraction.
member.returns: A text string that represents the fraction.
member.remarks:
In fractions the characters '/' and '#' are reserved if you need to write them you must write "\/" and "\#", respectively.
Do not combine fractions with super or subscript options, it is not supported (stacking commands cannot be nested).

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MText.Write(System.String)
member.summary: Adds the text to the current paragraph.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MText.Write(System.String,netDxf.Entities.MTextFormattingOptions)
member.summary: Adds the text to the current paragraph.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MText.EndParagraph
member.summary: Ends the current paragraph.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MText.StartParagraph
member.summary: Starts a new paragraph.
member.remarks:
When no paragraph options are used, strictly speaking, there is no need to call this method, the previous paragraph options will be inherited.
When there is no need to change the paragraph options from the previous, it is no necessary to pass again the same instance, the paragraph characteristics are inherited from the previous one. This way no codes needs to be written and it will save some characters in the final string.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MText.StartParagraph(netDxf.Entities.MTextParagraphOptions)
member.summary: Starts a new paragraph.
member.remarks:
When no paragraph options are used, strictly speaking, there is no need to call this method, the previous paragraph options will be inherited.
When there is no need to change the paragraph options from the previous, it is no necessary to pass again the same instance, the paragraph characteristics are inherited from the previous one. This way no codes needs to be written and it will save some characters in the final string.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MText.PlainText
member.summary: Obtains the MText text value without the formatting codes, control characters like tab '\t' will be preserved in the result, the new paragraph command "\P" will be converted to new line feed '\r\n'.
member.returns: MText text value without the formatting codes.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MText.TransformBy(netDxf.Matrix3,netDxf.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves, scales, and/or rotates the current entity given a 3x3 transformation matrix and a translation vector.
member.remarks:
Non-uniform scaling is not supported, it would require to decompose each line into independent Text entities. When the current Text entity does not belong to a DXF document, the text will use the DefaultMirrText when a symmetry is performed; otherwise, the drawing variable MirrText will be used.
Matrix3 adopts the convention of using column vectors to represent a transformation matrix.

member.summary: Gets or sets the superscript and subscript text height as a multiple of the current text height.

member.summary: Gets or sets the font that will override the default defined in the TextStyle.

Set as null or empty to apply the default font.

member.summary: Gets or sets the space between characters as a multiple of the original spacing between characters.
member.remarks: Valid values range from a minimum of .75 to 4 times the original spacing between characters. Set as 1.0 to apply the default character space factor.

member.summary: At least (taller characters will override)

member.name: F:netDxf.Entities.MTextLineSpacingStyle.Exact
member.summary: Exact (taller characters will not override)

member.summary: Multiple (only applicable in MTextParagraphOptions).
member.remarks: Instead of assigning a value to line spacing, you specify spacing according to text height.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.MTextParagraphOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MTextParagraphOptions class.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MTextParagraphOptions.HeightFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the paragraph height factor.
member.remarks: Set as 1.0 to apply the default height factor.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MTextParagraphOptions.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the paragraph justification (text horizontal alignment).

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MTextParagraphOptions.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the paragraph line vertical alignment.
member.remarks: The vertical alignment affects how fractions, superscripts, subscripts, and characters of different heights are placed in a paragraph line. By default the paragraph vertical alignment is Center.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MTextParagraphOptions.SpacingBefore
member.summary: Specifies the spacing before the paragraphs.
member.remarks:
If set to zero no value will be applied and the default will be inherited. When it is non zero, valid values range from 0.25 to 4.0.
The distance between two paragraphs is determined by the total of the after paragraph spacing value of the upper paragraph and the before paragraph spacing value of the lower paragraph.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MTextParagraphOptions.SpacingAfter
member.summary: Specifies the spacing before or after the paragraph.
member.remarks:
If set to zero no value will be applied and the default will be inherited. When it is non zero, valid values range from 0.25 to 4.0.
The distance between two paragraphs is determined by the total of the after paragraph spacing value of the upper paragraph and the before paragraph spacing value of the lower paragraph.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MTextParagraphOptions.FirstLineIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indent value for the first line of the paragraph.
member.remarks:
Valid values range from -10000.0 to 10000.0, the default value 0.0.
Negative first line indent values are limited by the left indent, in the case its absolute value is larger than the left indent, when applied to the paragraph it will be automatically adjusted .

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MTextParagraphOptions.LeftIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the left indent of the current paragraph.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 0.0 to 10000.0, the default value 0.0.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MTextParagraphOptions.RightIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the right indent value of the paragraphs.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 0.0 to 10000.0, the default value 0.0.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.MTextParagraphOptions.LineSpacingFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the paragraph line spacing factor.
member.remarks: Percentage of default line spacing to be applied. Valid values range from 0.25 to 4.0, the default value 1.0.

member.summary: Get or sets the paragraph line spacing style.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.PolyfaceMeshFace
member.summary: Represents a polyface mesh face.
member.remarks:
The way the vertex indexes for a polyface mesh are defined follows the DXF documentation. The values of the vertex indexes specify one of the previously defined vertexes by the index in the list plus one. If the index is negative, the edge that begins with that vertex is invisible. For example if the vertex index in the list is 0 the vertex index for the face will be 1, and if the edge between the vertexes 0 and 1 is hidden the vertex index for the face will be -1.
The maximum number of vertexes per face is 4.

member.name: M:netDxf.Entities.PolyfaceMeshFace.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PolyfaceMeshFace class.
member.remarks: By default the face is made up of four vertexes.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PolyfaceMeshFace class.
member.param: Array of indexes to the vertex list of a polyface mesh that makes up the face.

Non-uniform and zero scaling local to the dimension entity are not supported.

Matrix3 adopts the convention of using column vectors to represent a transformation matrix.

member.name: P:netDxf.Entities.Shape.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the shape.
member.remarks:
The shape size is relative to the actual size of the shape definition. The size value works as an scale value applied to the dimensions of the shape definition. The DXF allows for negative values but that is the same as rotating the shape 180 degrees.
Size values must be greater than zero. Default: 1.0.

member.summary: Gets or sets the shape rotation in degrees.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.SplineCreationMethod
member.summary: Defines how the spline entity was created.

member.name: F:netDxf.Entities.SplineCreationMethod.FitPoints
member.summary: Creates a degree 3 (cubic) B-spline by specifying fit points that the spline must pass through.

member.name: F:netDxf.Entities.SplineCreationMethod.ControlPoints
member.summary: Creates a spline by specifying control points.

member.name: T:netDxf.Entities.SplineKnotParameterization
member.summary: Specifies the knot parameterization, computational methods that determines how the component curves between successive fit points within a spline are blended.

member.name: F:netDxf.Entities.SplineKnotParameterization.FitChord
member.summary: Chord-Length method.
member.remarks: Spaces the knots connecting each component curve to be proportional to the distances between each associated pair of fit points.

member.name: F:netDxf.Entities.SplineKnotParameterization.FitSqrtChord
member.summary: Centripetal method.
member.remarks: Spaces the knots connecting each component curve to be proportional to the square root of the distance between each associated pair of fit points. This method usually produces "gentler" curves.

member.name: F:netDxf.Entities.SplineKnotParameterization.FitUniform
member.summary: Equidistant method.
member.remarks: Spaces the knots of each component curve to be equal, regardless of the spacing of the fit points. This method often produces curves that overshoot the fit points.

member.name: F:netDxf.Entities.SplineKnotParameterization.FitCustom
member.summary: Only applicable when a spline has been converted from the control points to the fit point creation method.
